issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:**‚Ää jbrownvisuals@gmail.com
- **Twitter:**‚Ää@jakeblockchain
- **Main project/association:** Built on Bitcoin podcast. Ops at Bitflow. Prev VC at Bitcoin Frontier Fund.
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:** 

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäBitcoinMarketMap - No BS, What's Live
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $5k
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** To map and highlight the applications currently live on mainnet within the broader Bitcoin ecosystem.
- **Grant Audience:**‚ÄäCrypto Twitter users and others who seek a clear, current view of truly live applications, not just marketing.
- **Grant Team:**‚Ää‚Ää Me vibe coding + crowdsourcing live apps from other ecosystems

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäTo establish a clean, up-to-date dashboard that clearly shows what is actually live across the Bitcoin ecosystem. This will serve as a home base to separate real, deployed projects from purely marketed ones (e.g., highlighting that projects like Stacks have many live apps, while others, like Arch, have had prolonged pre-live marketing). I already own the domain bitcoinmarketmap.com.
- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää This website can help users discern between what is marketing and what is real quickly by going to the BitcoinMarketMap. Stacks is one of the leaders in deployed applications in the Bitcoin eco, which can be seen more clearly with BitcoinMarketMap.
- **Grant Risks:** I'll be vibe coding this on weekends. So potential technical limitations might arise. But this risk is low as the website is not technically difficult, and I know technically minded people who'd be willing to help at roadblocks.
- **Traction:** No traction. Done some initial design mockups and vibe coding.

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:**‚Ää BitcoinMarketMap.com website with a database of Bitcoin projects, broken down by ecosystem. (Bitcoin L1, Lightning, Off-chain, Sidechains, Metaprotocols)
Each entry will include: ecosystem, name, description, logo, and a link to the main product. 
A Stacks banner will be placed on the homepage for the first six months.
- **Milestones:** Only one: Expected to be finished within one month. A portion of the grant funds will then be used as an incentive for users from other ecosystems to crowdsource live dapps via a Google Form.

Thanks for reviewing. 
Hit me with your questions.
Jake.

issues.title: Design Driven Development by Rocky & the Block
issues.body:
## Rocky's Proven Track Record

![BNS One Impact - Rocky's Design Success](https://github.com/exponentlabshq/sip-31-interim-grant/raw/master/bns-screenshot-impact.jpeg)

*Rocky's UI/UX redesign for BNS.One (Bitcoin Name Service) demonstrating measurable impact on platform success and user adoption.*

### Zero Authority DAO: Measurable Design Impact
Visit: https://zeroauthoritydao.com/

![Zero Authority Growth Analytics](https://github.com/exponentlabshq/sip-31-interim-grant/raw/master/zero-auth-growth-analytics.jpeg)

**üìä Growth Stats After Rocky's UI/UX Redesign:**
- **Unique Visitors:** ~10x increase (+~970%)
- **Page Views:** ~25x increase (+~2,370%)
- **Bounce Rate:** 32% improvement (from 44% ‚Üí 30%)
- **Event Completions (Engagement ROI):** Low baseline ‚Üí 4,700+ events (massive positive shift)

These metrics demonstrate the direct business impact of exceptional design work‚ÄîRocky's redesign didn't just make Zero Authority look better, it drove real user growth, engagement, and retention.

## üôÇ Applicant Information                
- **Email:** rocky@exponentlabs.ai
- **Twitter:** @rockyntheblock
- **Main project/association:** Exponent Labs LLC - Stacks ecosystem development and design
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
  - Rocky lead the UI/UX Experience Redesign for Zero Authority, resulting in **10x visitor growth (+970%)**, **25x page view increase (+2,370%)**, **32% bounce rate improvement**, and **4,700+ event completions**
  - Rocky lead the UI/UX Experience Redesign for BNS One (Bitcoin Name Service), contributing to platform success and user adoption
  - Demonstrated track record of significant ROI on design investment across Stacks applications (industry standard: $100 return per $1 invested)
  - Demonstrated track record of leading mentees and helping them secure permanent full-time jobs in tech (Ayden, Christina, Tien, etc.)

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** Design-Driven Development (DDD) for Stacks
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $16,000 USD (8 projects √ó $2,000/project, delivered biweekly over 16 weeks)
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Train and mentor a cohort of 5-8 UI/UX designers through hands-on design audits and redesigns of 8 top Stacks applications (one project every 2 weeks), building a sustainable talent pipeline while improving ecosystem UX and reaching 2,000+ community members through public education.
- **Grant Audience:** Aspiring UI/UX designers, front-end developers seeking design skills, Stacks project teams, Bitcoin builders, and the broader Stacks community
- **Grant Team:** Rocky (@rockyntheblock)

## üìä Impact Metrics & Cost Justification

**Primary Impact: Designer Training**
- **5-8 trained UI/UX designers** with professional portfolio work (8 real projects each)
- **Cost per designer trained:** $2,000-$3,200 per designer for 16 weeks of intensive mentorship
- **Value created per designer:** Each trained designer can deliver $50k-$100k+ annual value to ecosystem (based on industry design rates of $75-150/hour)
- **ROI timeframe:** Each designer generates 15-30x return within first year through project work

**Secondary Impact: Ecosystem Reach**
- **8 Stacks project teams** receive professional design audits and implementation guides
- **2,000+ community members** reached through 8 biweekly livestreamed review sessions
- **500+ engaged viewers** attending live sessions and participating in Q&A
- **100+ developers** implementing design improvements based on audits
- **50+ builders** accessing reusable component library and design patterns

**Tertiary Impact: Long-term Ecosystem Growth**
- **Stacks Design Guild formation** creating sustainable talent pool for future projects
- **70%+ designer retention** ensuring trained designers remain active in ecosystem 6+ months
- **Self-sustaining mentorship** where trained designers mentor next cohort

**Cost Breakdown & Justification:**
- **Mentor compensation (Rocky):** $8,000 (50% of budget) - 20+ hours/week for 16 weeks (one intensive project every 2 weeks) including audit work, mentorship sessions, livestreams, and deliverable reviews
- **Mentee stipends:** $4,000 (25% of budget) - Small stipends for 5-8 mentees ($500-800 each) to enable participation
- **Tools & infrastructure:** $2,000 (12.5% of budget) - Figma licenses, design tools, hosting for component library
- **Community bounties:** $2,000 (12.5% of budget) - Implementation bounties for projects adopting designs

**Why designers are valuable:**
- Industry shows $100 return for every $1 invested in design
- Rocky's proven track record: Zero Authority and BNS One success demonstrate measurable business impact
- Design talent shortage is critical bottleneck for Stacks builders preparing for TGEs and listings
- Trained designers provide ongoing value across multiple projects (not single-use)

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

- **Grant Mission:** Empower 5-8 aspiring UI/UX designers in the Stacks ecosystem to learn professional design practices through hands-on mentorship, real-world project audits, and collaborative creation of experience design prototypes. By training designers on 8 high-impact applications driving the path to $1B TVL in DeFi, we establish a sustainable talent pipeline that elevates design as a first-class discipline alongside smart contract development. As the leading Bitcoin L2 focuses on DeFi growth, user experience is table stakes‚Äîthis grant ensures the ecosystem has the human capital needed for long-term sustainability and builder success.

- **Grant Impact:** The critical output is a cohort of 5-8 trained UI/UX designers equipped with real-world experience on 8 major Stacks applications (BoostX, Deorganized Media, Velar, StackingDAO, Hermetica, Boom Wallet, Faktory.fun, and Skullcoin). Each designer will work alongside Rocky in a mentorship model, learning to conduct audits, create prototypes, and deliver professional redesigns. Beyond the core cohort, the grant reaches 2,000+ community members through livestreamed sessions and provides professional design resources to 8 project teams. As Stacks accelerates toward its $1B TVL milestone and positions itself as the fastest Bitcoin L2 with superior user experience and low-cost transactions, design excellence becomes critical infrastructure. This acts as a design-powered social layer that strengthens the leading Bitcoin L2 by attracting and retaining design-driven community members, ensuring builders have the resources needed as adoption scales.

- **Grant Risks:** 
  - **Risk:** Designer mentees may lack foundational skills. **Mitigation:** Screen candidates for basic design understanding (portfolio review + skills assessment), provide beginner-friendly guides, and offer 1-on-1 mentorship sessions tailored to skill level. One interested participant is currently in school studying UI/UX Design.
  - **Risk:** Low retention of trained designers post-grant (target: 70%+). **Mitigation:** Build community through biweekly livestreams, create ongoing paid opportunities through project partnerships, establish Stacks Design Guild with recurring projects, and track retention via 3-month and 6-month check-ins.
  - **Risk:** Quality dilution with multiple designers producing work. **Mitigation:** Rocky reviews all deliverables before publication, provides multiple feedback loops per project, establishes quality rubric for audits/prototypes, and maintains high bar demonstrated in Zero Authority and BNS One work.
  - **Risk:** Low community engagement in livestreams. **Mitigation:** Partner with project teams to promote sessions, offer bounties for participation, record and publish for async viewing, and leverage existing Stacks community channels for distribution.

- **Traction:**
  - **Zero Authority:** Rocky's UI/UX redesign delivered exceptional measurable results:
    - **10x increase in unique visitors** (+~970%)
    - **25x increase in page views** (+~2,370%)
    - **32% bounce rate improvement** (44% ‚Üí 30%)
    - **4,700+ event completions** (from low baseline to massive engagement)
    - Increases in transaction volume, new wallet creation, and revenue generation
  - **BNS One:** Design improvements led to strong user adoption and platform success, demonstrating ROI on design investment
  - **Existing demand:** 3+ designers already interested in participating based on informal outreach
  - **Project interest:** Multiple projects (BoostX, Deorganized Media, Velar) already confirmed interest in receiving design audits
  - **Ecosystem demand:** As Stacks focuses on DeFi growth and targets $250mm TVL by end of Q2 2025, the ecosystem lacks comprehensive UI/UX training despite strong backend infrastructure with Nakamoto, sBTC, and Clarity 4 upgrades
  - **Builder needs:** Stacks builders with listable tokens and growing protocols need professional design support to compete as the ecosystem scales and attracts millions of users
  - **Proven ROI:** Industry standard shows $100 return for every $1 invested in design‚Äîcritical for value accrual as adoption accelerates
  - **Alignment with roadmap:** This grant complements ongoing ecosystem growth initiatives including SIP-031 Interim Grant program, Stacks Ascent, and DeFi growth plans

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

**Duration:** 16 weeks (4 months)

**Schedule:** One project every 2 weeks to allow for thorough mentorship and high-quality deliverables

**Primary Deliverable:** Cohort of 5-8 trained UI/UX experience designers equipped to elevate Stacks ecosystem design standards.

**Biweekly Deliverables (8 complete packages):**

Each 2-week cycle focuses on one application with designer mentees working alongside Rocky:

1. **Design Audit Report** - Mentees learn to identify UX issues, friction points, accessibility gaps, and user flow problems through hands-on analysis
2. **Experience Design Prototypes** - Mentees collaboratively create multiple design variations and prototypes under Rocky's guidance
3. **UI/UX Redesign** - High-fidelity mockups with complete design system (colors, typography, components, spacing) produced by mentee team
4. **Live Review Session** - Public walkthrough streamed to the Stacks community where mentees present their work and receive feedback
5. **Implementation Guide** - Component specifications, front-end recommendations, and technical documentation
6. **Mentorship Sessions** - 1-on-1 classes and design critiques helping mentees develop professional skills

## üìà Milestones: Impact-Focused

**Milestone 1 - Week 4 Complete (End of Week 4)**
**Amount:** $4,000 (25% of budget)

**Impact Metrics:**
- ‚úÖ **5-8 designers onboarded** with confirmed participation and skill assessments completed
- ‚úÖ **2 projects audited** (BoostX, Deorganized Media) with professional design audit reports
- ‚úÖ **2 sets of redesign mockups** delivered to project teams
- ‚úÖ **400+ community members reached** through 2 livestreamed review sessions
- ‚úÖ **100+ engaged viewers** participating in live Q&A and feedback
- ‚úÖ **2 implementation guides** published for ecosystem reference

**Deliverables:**
- Weeks 1-2: BoostX audit + redesign + live session + mentorship
- Weeks 3-4: Deorganized Media audit + redesign + live session + mentorship

---

**Milestone 2 - Week 8 Complete (End of Week 8)**
**Amount:** $4,000 (25% of budget)

**Impact Metrics:**
- ‚úÖ **4 projects audited** (cumulative) with actionable UX improvements identified
- ‚úÖ **4 project teams** receiving implementation guidance
- ‚úÖ **800+ community members reached** (cumulative) through livestreams
- ‚úÖ **200+ engaged viewers** (cumulative) learning design practices
- ‚úÖ **5-8 designers showing skill progression** (measured via portfolio quality assessment)
- ‚úÖ **2 projects beginning implementation** of design recommendations

**Deliverables:**
- Weeks 5-6: Velar audit + redesign + live session + mentorship (DeFi UX focus)
- Weeks 7-8: StackingDAO audit + redesign + live session + mentorship

---

**Milestone 3 - Week 12 Complete (End of Week 12)**
**Amount:** $4,000 (25% of budget)

**Impact Metrics:**
- ‚úÖ **6 projects audited** (cumulative) driving ecosystem-wide UX improvements
- ‚úÖ **1,200+ community members reached** (cumulative)
- ‚úÖ **300+ engaged viewers** (cumulative)
- ‚úÖ **Component library published** with reusable design patterns from 6 projects
- ‚úÖ **50+ developers** accessing component library and design system docs
- ‚úÖ **3+ projects implementing** design recommendations (50% implementation target tracking)
- ‚úÖ **5-8 designers** with 6 professional projects in portfolio (job-ready threshold)

**Deliverables:**
- Weeks 9-10: Hermetica audit + redesign + live session + mentorship (Financial UX)
- Weeks 11-12: Boom Wallet audit + redesign + live session + mentorship (Wallet UX)

---

**Milestone 4 - Week 16 Complete (Grant Completion)**
**Amount:** $4,000 (25% of budget)

**Impact Metrics:**
- ‚úÖ **8 projects audited** with complete design audit packages delivered
- ‚úÖ **8 project teams** equipped with implementation-ready designs
- ‚úÖ **2,000+ community members reached** through all livestreams
- ‚úÖ **500+ engaged viewers** (cumulative) educated on design practices
- ‚úÖ **5-8 designers certified** with 8 professional projects each (64 total projects)
- ‚úÖ **Stacks Design Guild formed** with recurring meeting schedule and project pipeline
- ‚úÖ **4+ projects implementing** design recommendations (50% target achieved)
- ‚úÖ **100+ developers** using component library and design patterns
- ‚úÖ **Measurable UX improvements** in at least 2 projects (engagement metrics tracked)

**Deliverables:**
- Weeks 13-14: Faktory.fun audit + redesign + live session + mentorship
- Weeks 15-16: Skullcoin audit + redesign + live session + mentorship
- Final: Component library published, Design Guild established, impact report completed

**Long-term Tracking (Post-Grant):**
- **3-month check-in:** Designer retention rate, projects implementing designs, new projects taking designs
- **6-month check-in:** Designer employment/freelance status, ecosystem impact measurements, Design Guild sustainability

---

## üìã Project Scope

| Weeks | Project | Type | Mentorship Focus | Strategic Focus | Expected Reach |
|-------|---------|------|------------------|-----------------|----------------|
| 1-2 | BoostX | Features & integrations | Audit methodology | Fast, consistent user flows that compete with top ecosystems | 200+ viewers |
| 3-4 | Deorganized Media | Content platform | Prototyping techniques | User engagement patterns for Web3 content platforms | 200+ viewers |
| 5-6 | Velar | Leading DEX | DeFi UX patterns | Low-cost transaction flows & liquidity interfaces for DeFi TVL growth | 300+ viewers |
| 7-8 | StackingDAO | Liquid staking protocol | Staking interface design | Simplified stacking experience & Bitcoin yield | 250+ viewers |
| 9-10 | Hermetica | Bitcoin-backed stablecoin (USDh) | Financial app UX | Stablecoin liquidity flows critical for Stacks DeFi growth | 250+ viewers |
| 11-12 | Boom Wallet | Stacks wallet | Wallet UX & security design | Wallet integrations & onboarding flows for millions of new users | 300+ viewers |
| 13-14 | Faktory.fun | NFT & token launchpad | NFT marketplace design | Token launch UX supporting builders' TGE readiness | 250+ viewers |
| 15-16 | Skullcoin | Community token | Community-driven design | Community engagement patterns for ecosystem network effects | 250+ viewers |

**Alternative candidates:** STXTools and other high-impact Stacks applications may be considered based on project availability and community input.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Technology Stack
- Lovable - AI-powered development platform
- Shadcn - Component library
- Tailwind CSS - Styling framework
- Figma/Design tools for high-fidelity mockups
- Design systems and accessibility standards (WCAG)

## üìä Success Metrics

**Primary (Talent Development):**
- ‚úÖ **5-8 trained UI/UX designers** with professional 8-project portfolios (vs. goal: 5-8)
- ‚úÖ **100% mentee completion rate** (all enrolled designers complete 16 weeks)
- ‚úÖ **70%+ designer retention** in Stacks ecosystem 6 months post-grant
- ‚úÖ **Stacks Design Guild formed** with recurring meetings and project pipeline
- ‚úÖ **3+ trained designers** securing paid work within 3 months

**Secondary (Project Deliverables):**
- ‚úÖ **8 complete design audit packages** delivered on schedule (1 every 2 weeks)
- ‚úÖ **8 project teams** equipped with implementation guides
- ‚úÖ **50%+ implementation rate** (4+ projects implementing designs within 6 months)
- ‚úÖ **Reusable component library** with patterns from all 8 projects

**Tertiary (Community Impact):**
- ‚úÖ **2,000+ community members reached** through 8 livestreamed sessions
- ‚úÖ **500+ engaged viewers** attending live sessions and Q&A
- ‚úÖ **100+ developers** using component library and design patterns
- ‚úÖ **8 public education sessions** teaching design best practices
- ‚úÖ **Measurable UX improvements** in implementing projects (tracked via engagement metrics)

**Long-term Impact:**
- ‚úÖ **Self-sustaining design community** continues mentoring new designers as ecosystem scales
- ‚úÖ **Trained designers take freelance/full-time roles** with Stacks builders and protocols
- ‚úÖ **Design-driven development becomes standard practice**, supporting healthy Stacks DeFi and builder growth
- ‚úÖ **Stacks Design Guild serves as talent pool** for projects seeking UI/UX expertise as they prepare for TGEs and listings
- ‚úÖ **Position Stacks as premier destination** for designers in the leading Bitcoin L2, attracting design talent alongside DeFi capital
- ‚úÖ **Ecosystem growth from ground up** through human capital investment, ensuring the leading Bitcoin L2 has design infrastructure needed for long-term sustainability and value accrual
- ‚úÖ **Support builders with design resources** as Stacks achieves roadmap goals: $1B TVL, millions of users, and fastest Bitcoin L2 performance

---

Beyond the core cohort, the grant reaches 2,000+ community members through livestreamed sessions and provides professional design resources to 8 project teams. As Stacks accelerates toward its $1B TVL milestone and positions itself as the fastest Bitcoin L2 with superior user experience and low-cost transactions, design excellence becomes critical infrastructure. This acts as a design-powered social layer that strengthens the leading Bitcoin L2 by attracting and retaining design-driven community members, ensuring builders have the resources needed as adoption scales.

- Grant Risks:
- Risk: Designer mentees may lack foundational skills. Mitigation: Screen candidates for basic design understanding (portfolio review + skills assessment), provide beginner-friendly guides, and offer 1-on-1 mentorship sessions tailored to skill level. One interested participant is currently in school studying UI/UX Design.
- Risk: Low retention of trained designers post-grant (target: 70%+). Mitigation: Build community through biweekly livestreams, create ongoing paid opportunities through project partnerships, establish Stacks Design Guild with recurring projects, and track retention via 3-month and 6-month check-ins.
- Risk: Quality dilution with multiple designers producing work. Mitigation: Rocky reviews all deliverables before publication, provides multiple feedback loops per project, establishes quality rubric for audits/prototypes, and maintains high bar demonstrated in Zero Authority and BNS One work.
- Risk: Low community engagement in livestreams. Mitigation: Partner with project teams to promote sessions, offer bounties for participation, record and publish for async viewing, and leverage existing Stacks community channels for distribution.

- Traction:
- Zero Authority: Rocky's UI/UX redesign delivered exceptional measurable results:
- 10x increase in unique visitors (+~970%)
- 25x increase in page views (+~2,370%)

- Increases in transaction volume, new wallet creation, and revenue generation
- BNS One: Design improvements led to strong user adoption and platform success, demonstrating ROI on design investment
- Existing demand: 3+ designers already interested in participating based on informal outreach
- Project interest: Multiple projects (BoostX, Deorganized Media, Velar) already confirmed interest in receiving design audits
- Ecosystem demand: As Stacks focuses on DeFi growth and targets $250mm TVL by end of Q2 2025, the ecosystem lacks comprehensive UI/UX training despite strong backend infrastructure with Nakamoto, sBTC, and Clarity 4 upgrades
- Builder needs: Stacks builders with listable tokens and growing protocols need professional design support to compete as the ecosystem scales and attracts millions of users
- Proven ROI: Industry standard shows $100 return for every $1 invested in design‚Äîcritical for value accrual as adoption accelerates
- Alignment with roadmap: This grant complements ongoing ecosystem growth initiatives including SIP-031 Interim Grant program, Stacks Ascent, and DeFi growth plans

cuevasm_comments.body:
Whew just squeezed that one in under the deadline ay @exponentlabshq ü§£. 

The committee met this morning and this grant was one of the more in-depth conversations. There is a lot to like here and the spirit of improving design/experience for Stacks apps is a good one. That said, funding an agency model generally hasn't been a focus for grants in the past - there are various reasons for this that I won't bore you with here, but we put our heads together on 'what could we say yes to' in this general realm. 

Here's what we're proposing: 
- Approve the first Milestones, but at $8k, double the requested amount for M1 and 50% of the total request. You would still serve two teams as proposed at 2k and 2k, but with the rest of the funding, we'd like to see that work get abstracted into a design kit, docs, guidance, a course, or some combination you think is the best fit that is widely usable by the rest of the builders. We think this will be more impactful because it is a resource that can scale vs. being essentially the agency trap where there's always limited bandwidth of the providers talent hours. Worth noting: it is is tricky for us to get into the game of subsidizing some folks' design work through an effort like this and not others, it is a losing game of perceived fairness for us where one team feels slighted they weren't given the same resource, so this sidesteps that issue using the first two teams as guinea pigs from which you can create a resource that helps everyone.
- Beyond that, we'd like to see your measurables align to outcomes and impact for the business instead of 'views'. Some of the strong support from @xyzerobtc is a good example, though we have not dug into the attribution methodology (we're happy to take y'alls word there and just assume that it was only design work that resulted in all that growth, but this is typically really hard to accurately measure). Could you take a swing at a reworking them accordingly with impact based outcomes instead of listed views?
- Further, the guild and training aspect is very interesting, but we're not fully convinced that we can take folks from 'aspiring' to high-quality designers in such a short time as to be impactful on a schedule that helps key teams break out fast. Our preference would be that you focus on bringing in/recruiting _already_ trained and skilled designers for pointed, clear projects in the ecosystem (perhaps in the order you've already laid out). If you can matchmake and align on clear scopes with clear impacts, we can fund those as subsequent milestones. Our rationale: Training brand new designers is difficult and takes longer than 6 months except with very rare exception so we think this would reduce risk and ensure the quality of this talent. Our opinion is that we don't need to train folks from scratch, there are many designers hoping to get into the space that already have skills and are well developed - bootcamps for taking folks from zero to professional already exist. 

For now we're provisionally approving M1 as I've outlined it above pending your confirmation. We will wait to hear from you on the second two items so that we reconsider the rest of the proposal. Thanks!

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks for the submission @block9app! A number of things off the top here for you to consider:

- There's very little listed under traction that is measured in user growth, TVL, etc. Finished work is great, but we're trying to avoid 'build it and they will come' scenarios. Could you please speak to what traction you currently have?
- Similarly, could you talk us through why this and why now? Do you have clear indications of demand for a product like this? Waitlist? etc.? What makes you confident there are people in need of this and willing to pay for it (at some point).
- Most importantly, I'd like to see this proposal focus on one thing, right now you are proposing what I perceive to be two (maybe 3) very different things. One is an app for secure document exchange, another is a service business or agency. Related, I personally find the notion of postcards written to business owners confusing - is this a feature you expect to launch in the app? Is there clear indication of demand for this? Is it served inside the document sharing application? Is that just part of the marketing plan?
 
Generally, I think the proposal takes far too long to get to market and shipping marketing before the app is actually ready to be used by users is most often a waste of those resources. Flipping this around such that you get an MVP out asap and in the hands of users would be something the committee will insist on, from there further marketing can drive growth. In this proposal we aren't getting to market until February at a cost of $44k. I would challenge you to throw everything that's absolutely not necessary to be in scope out, and pare this down into one 10k milestone that gets something live and in the hands of users within a month or so. From there we can readily see if this has legs. If you'd like more hands on help with this process, Stacks Ascent (https://stacks.org/ascent) or DeGrants (https://degrants.xyz) may be a better starting place as stewards and ecosystem contributors can get hands on with you to help you do this :).

issues.title: Chain of Custody: On-Chain Voting for Curated Artworks
issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:** anibal@curatorbtc.com
- **Twitter:** [@CuratorBTC](https://twitter.com/CuratorBTC)
- **Main project/association:** Curator Collective (CuratorBTC.com)
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
  - Active for ~4 years building in the Stacks ecosystem, linking physical art with digital collectibles/NFTs on Bitcoin & Stacks.
  - Curated multiple collections including *Future of Money* and *NFTs for Peace*, bridging artists and collectors.
  - Long-standing contributor and community participant; this is our first time applying for a grant from the Stacks Foundation.

---

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** *Curator Collective: Community-Governed Art Platform (Phase 1)*
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** 5,000 USD
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Build and deploy a wallet-integrated web app that enables NFT holders to propose and vote on actions for physical artworks in Curator Collective‚Äôs existing collections.
- **Grant Audience:** NFT collectors, digital/physical artists, and Stacks ecosystem users interested in governance and community-driven art ownership.
- **Grant Team:** @anibalbosco (lead), with support from Curator Collective collaborators.

---

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**  
  To expand Curator Collective‚Äôs platform by introducing a transparent, on-chain decision-making tool where NFT holders can collectively decide the fate of physical artworks already in our collections.

- **Grant Impact:**  
  This project will strengthen the Stacks ecosystem by demonstrating a live, working example of community governance tied to real-world assets. Success will be measured by the number of proposals created, votes cast, and at least one completed real-world action (e.g., sale, loan, or donation of an artwork) resulting directly from the on-chain governance process.

- **Grant Risks:**  
  - *Risk: Low engagement by collectors.*  
    *Mitigation:* Begin with known, engaged collectors from existing collections, and use outreach to onboard them into voting.  We already did a crude test earlier this year using currently available tools in the ecosystem using ballot.gg: https://x.com/anibalbosco/status/1880737928093344169
  - *Risk: Technical complexity of wallet integration or voting logic.*  
    *Mitigation:* Start with minimal viable architecture, use existing Stacks tools/libraries, and expand iteratively.  
  - *Risk: Real-world logistics (e.g., shipping, disputes).*  
    *Mitigation:* Limit scope to decision-making app; physical logistics handled by Curator Collective as a service.

- **Traction:**  
  - *Active users:* Curator Collective has already onboarded ‚Ää[artists](https://www.curatorbtc.com/artists) and collectors across several [collections](https://www.curatorbtc.com/collections). A great example of a collection engaging users is [NFTs for Peace](https://stacks.gamma.io/collections/nfts-for-peace): this was THE first generative music collection on Stacks, in which the NFTs backing the physical art were music with visuals co-created with Sean Longstreet](https://x.com/longstreetBTC), Manuel Gimferrer (who did the original composition), Adrian Lewandowski (coding), and number of musicians that recorded some of the stems used for generation. This also had contributions from several community members that prepared their own versions mixing stems. One of my favorite ones is [this one](https://stacks.gamma.io/collections/nfts-for-peace/330) by [jim.btc](https://x.com/jimdotbtc), the creator of Audionals.

  - *Transaction volume:* Prior NFT collections minted and distributed. For example, the collection [Future of Money](https://stacks.gamma.io/collections/future-of-money) was THE first collection ever to mint using a SIP-10 token for payment and it sold out in 10 minutes. In addition to the primary mint volume, the secondary market volume of Curator Collective collections is 15400 STX.
  - *TVL:* Not applicable.  
  - *Waitlist:* Not applicable. During phase 2, outside the scope of this grant, we will build of platform for crowdsourcing the purchases of new physical pieces; a variation of the current model in which the Curator Collective buys the paintings beforehand.

---

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:**  
  A working web application where NFT holders connect their wallets, create proposals about artworks, and vote on them. Outcomes are recorded on-chain, and Curator Collective carries out real-world actions in accordance with results.

- **Milestones:**  
  Since the request is below $10k, milestones are simple:  
  1. **Month 1‚Äì2:** Design and develop wallet integration + proposal creation system.  
  2. **Month 2‚Äì3:** Implement on-chain voting logic and UI for viewing proposals and results.  
  3. **Month 4:** Run pilot vote with an existing Curator Collective artwork; document, summarize, and share results.

- Email: anibal@curatorbtc.com

- Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:
- Active for ~4 years building in the Stacks ecosystem, linking physical art with digital collectibles/NFTs on Bitcoin & Stacks.
- Curated multiple collections including Future of Money and NFTs for Peace, bridging artists and collectors.
- Long-standing contributor and community participant; this is our first time applying for a grant from the Stacks Foundation.

---

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- Grant Name: Curator Collective: Community-Governed Art Platform (Phase 1)
- Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC): 5,000 USD
- Grant Goal (in one sentence): Build and deploy a wallet-integrated web app that enables NFT holders to propose and vote on actions for physical artworks in Curator Collective‚Äôs existing collections.
- Grant Audience: NFT collectors, digital/physical artists, and Stacks ecosystem users interested in governance and community-driven art ownership.
- Grant Team: @anibalbosco (lead), with support from Curator Collective collaborators.

---

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- Grant Mission:
To expand Curator Collective‚Äôs platform by introducing a transparent, on-chain decision-making tool where NFT holders can collectively decide the fate of physical artworks already in our collections.

- Grant Impact:
This project will strengthen the Stacks ecosystem by demonstrating a live, working example of community governance tied to real-world assets. Success will be measured by the number of proposals created, votes cast, and at least one completed real-world action (e.g., sale, loan, or donation of an artwork) resulting directly from the on-chain governance process.

- Grant Risks:
- Risk: Low engagement by collectors.
Mitigation: Begin with known, engaged collectors from existing collections, and use outreach to onboard them into voting. We already did a crude test earlier this year using currently available tools in the ecosystem using ballot.gg: https://x.com/anibalbosco/status/1880737928093344169
- Risk: Technical complexity of wallet integration or voting logic.
Mitigation: Start with minimal viable architecture, use existing Stacks tools/libraries, and expand iteratively.
- Risk: Real-world logistics (e.g., shipping, disputes).
Mitigation: Limit scope to decision-making app; physical logistics handled by Curator Collective as a service.

- Traction:
- Active users: Curator Collective has already onboarded ‚Ääartists and collectors across several collections. A great example of a collection engaging users is NFTs for Peace: this was THE first generative music collection on Stacks, in which the NFTs backing the physical art were music with visuals co-created with Sean Longstreet](https://x.com/longstreetBTC), Manuel Gimferrer (who did the original composition), Adrian Lewandowski (coding), and number of musicians that recorded some of the stems used for generation. This also had contributions from several community members that prepared their own versions mixing stems. One of my favorite ones is this one by jim.btc, the creator of Audionals.

- Transaction volume: Prior NFT collections minted and distributed. For example, the collection Future of Money was THE first collection ever to mint using a SIP-10 token for payment and it sold out in 10 minutes. In addition to the primary mint volume, the secondary market volume of Curator Collective collections is 15400 STX.
- TVL: Not applicable.
- Waitlist: Not applicable. During phase 2, outside the scope of this grant, we will build of platform for crowdsourcing the purchases of new physical pieces; a variation of the current model in which the Curator Collective buys the paintings beforehand.

---

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- Deliverable:
A working web application where NFT holders connect their wallets, create proposals about artworks, and vote on them. Outcomes are recorded on-chain, and Curator Collective carries out real-world actions in accordance with results.

- Milestones:
Since the request is below $10k, milestones are simple:
1. Month 1‚Äì2: Design and develop wallet integration + proposal creation system.
2. Month 2‚Äì3: Implement on-chain voting logic and UI for viewing proposals and results.
3. Month 4: Run pilot vote with an existing Curator Collective artwork; document, summarize, and share results.

issues.body:
## üôÇ **Applicant Information**

* **Email:** 888snazzy@gmail.com
* **Twitter:** @one_bns
* **Main project/association:** BNS One ‚Äì the go-to platform for BNS management and marketplace.
* **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
  * Delivered the first fully functional BNS marketplace with auctions, offers, counter-offers, zonefile upgrades, and advanced management tools.
  * Facilitated approximately 60,000 STX in trading volume since launch on 24 Dec 2024, highlighting strong early adoption.
  * Core infrastructure driving BNS adoption, supporting seamless registrations, daily user activity, and vibrant secondary trading.

## üìÉ **Grant Overview**

* **Grant Name:** BNS One: The Future of Bitcoin Identity
* **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $30,000 USD
* **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Enhance BNS One with mobile-first UI/UX, infrastructure reliability, an API for integrations, and global marketing to drive adoption.
* **Grant Audience:** Developers, BNS traders, namespace creators, dApps, wallets, Stacks users.
* **Grant Team:**
  * @snazzy_888 (Co-founder)
  * @instoppabile (Co-founder)

## üöÄ **Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction**

* **Grant Mission:**
  BNS One makes Bitcoin Name System management and trading accessible, seamless and scalable. This grant will fund improvements in the design and front-end functionality of the web app, a complete redesign of the mobile-first interface, and robust infrastructure for reliability. With a direct link through apps like Xverse, we want to provide users with the most seamless experience possible. In addition, the grant will help fund further development of new features, interoperability and identity integrations, alongside API development for broader ecosystem adoption and impact.

* **Grant Impact:** With over 22,000 engaged sessions and users in 65+ countries, BNS One is already the backbone of BNS activity on Stacks. A successful grant ensures smoother mobile experience, long-term infrastructure stability, new integrations across dApps/wallets, and a marketing campaign to onboard thousands of new users into the Stacks ecosystem.

* **Grant Risks:**

  * **Adoption risk:** Marketing may not reach new users ‚Üí mitigated by focusing on BNS + Stacks communities and measurable KPIs.
  * **Technical delays:** UI/UX and API upgrades take longer ‚Üí mitigated by proven dev capacity (delivered auctions, offers, counter-offers).
  * **Infrastructure costs:** Scaling beyond grant budget ‚Üí mitigated by efficient server management and staged rollouts.

* **Traction:**

  * **Active users:** ~750‚Äì800 monthly (many daily users), 6,500+ unique users year-to-date, with a strong engagement rate of 68%.
  * **Transaction volume:** ~60,000 STX since Dec 2024
  * **Geography:** Users in 65+ countries
  * **Ecosystem presence:** 22,000+ engaged sessions YTD, trusted daily by BNS community

## üõ£Ô∏è **Grant Roadmap & Deliverables**

**Deliverables:**

* Web app design and front-end improvements, plus mobile-first UI/UX redesign
* Long-term infrastructure (servers for 1‚Äì2 years)
* Public API for wallet + dApp integrations
* Global marketing and adoption campaign

**Milestones:**

* **M1:** Roll out redesigned UI/UX with mobile-first improvements; launch marketing preparation.
* **M2:** Secure infrastructure for 1-2 years, optimize servers, and begin API development.
* **M3:** Release public API with documentation; integrate with at least 2 dApps/wallets.
* **M4:** Execute global marketing campaign, targeting measurable increases in user growth and trading volume.

issues.title: ‚ÄäVibesDAO.fun -- Vibe Coding DAO on Stacks
issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:** daniel@hirevibes.io
- **Twitter:**‚Ää@dandunbtc
- **Main project/association:** HireVibes
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:** _Limit to 3 bullet points_

-> Manage the largest talent database on Stacks (6,000+)
-> Supported all funded teams on Stacks with technical recruiting 
-> Built an MVP of a self-sustaining Vibe Coding DAO 

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäVibesdao.fun: Vibe Coding DAO on Stacks
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):**‚Ää‚Ää$30,000
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Launch a Vibe Coding Start-up flywheel on Stacks; systematically funding a  high-utility apps that attract outside users and generate value, which is then recycled back into the ecosystem to fuel further development, create more jobs, which funds more start-ups and repeats the cycle.
- **Grant Audience:**‚Ää‚ÄäDevelopers, Designers, Founders
- **Grant Team:**‚Ää‚Ää[@sobz-dev](https://github.com/sobz-dev) [@Hashamjavedofficial](https://github.com/Hashamjavedofficial)  

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäVibes DAO‚Äôs mission is to launch a start-up flywheel on Stacks by rewarding contributors for building and marketing apps in an open, decentralized way. With this budget, we will implement *a points-based contribution system* where developers, designers, marketers and founders automatically earn tokens when milestones are achieved and apps reach the market. Over time, this creates a repeatable engine for producing Stacks apps while giving builders direct ownership in the ecosystems they help grow.
- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäWith this grant, we will deliver a Stacks-native contribution and reward system that makes it seamless for anyone to earn tokens by building or marketing Vibes DAO launched apps. Immediately, 20% of the grant budget will be allocated to the Vibes DAO Treasury, acting as a mini‚Äìdegrants program governed by VIBES token holders to fund and incentivize additional builders. Long term, the reward framework created through this grant can be adopted by other Stacks DAOs and teams, compounding ecosystem growth: more apps shipped, more contributors retained, and more value recycled back into Stacks through treasury expansion. Success will be measured in: #of contributors rewarded via the points system #of apps shipped to mainnet.
- **Grant Risks:** The primary risks are:
a) Low contributor participation - If builders do not engage, the pipeline of apps may stall.
Mitigation: Leverage our 6,000+ talent database and existing Jobs app to ensure contributor flow.
b) Complexity of fair rewards distribution - Misaligned incentives could lead to disputes over contributions.
Mitigation: Implement a transparent points-to-tokens system, with oversight from Vibes Dao Treasury Council and on-chain records of contributions.
c) Scope creep across too many apps - Risk of dilution if DAO tries to build everything at once.
Mitigation: Focus grant funds on launching 3-5 high quality flagship apps, proving the model before expanding.
- **Traction:** HireVibes already manages the largest talent network in the ecosystem (6,000+ developers, designers, etc.), giving us a strong base of contributors ready to engage. Many of these builders are actively looking for opportunities to add real projects to enhance their resumes, learn new tools, and work in a community-driven environment. We‚Äôve already shipped key components that demonstrate execution:

- DAO Infrastructure: The [Vibes DAO MVP](https://app.hirevibes.com/dao-community) is already live with open-source code available at [GitHub](https://github.com/hirevibes/vibes-dao)
- Marketing & Onboarding: We launched a dedicated landing page at [vibesdao.fun](https://vibesdao.fun/) to attract contributors and showcase the vision.
- Proven Impact Track Record: Our team previously built a transparent donation system at [HireVibes](https://www.hirevibes.com/donations) that funded 20+ clean-water wells in Africa‚Äîproviding safe drinking water to 4,000+ people to this day.

In addition, ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù is gaining traction as a fun and effective way for builders to upskill, get real experience while potentially earning rewards. With already owning the $VIBES token ticker, we are positioned to establish ourselves as _the_ _Vibe Coding DAO of crypto._

Current indicators of traction:

- Active users: ~200 monthly active users on the HireVibes platform applying and referring to open jobs.
- Transaction volume: ~$80,000+ distributed to the Vibes DAO treasury & regenerative finance projects through jobs filled on the platform.
- Treasury: ~$1,000 currently sitting in the Vibes DAO treasury, earmarked for contributor rewards.
- Pipeline: ~10 developers already on a waitlist to start building through Vibes DAO once fully launched.

This grant will allow us to scale from manual, experimental DAO payouts into a fully automated contribution system, unlocking the potential of thousands of builders and a steady pipeline of Bitcoin apps on Stacks.

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:** A Stacks-native contribution and reward system integrated into the Vibes DAO platform. This system will include;

- An interface where contributors can browse open tasks/bounties for Vibes DAO apps.
- A points-to-token reward engine that automatically tracks contributions and issues VIBES and STX tokens once milestones are verified.
- Launch of at least one flagship Bitcoin app to demonstrate the system in action and showcase shipped projects on contributors‚Äô resumes.

- **Milestones:** 

Milestone 1 ‚Äì DAO Treasury Expansion & Setup (Month 1)

- Allocate 20% of grant funds to the DAO Treasury (mini‚Äìdegrants model).
- Explain the transparent multisig system for payouts.
- Deliverable: Publicly documented DAO treasury with governance rules including a 7 day voting window.

Milestone 2 ‚Äì Contribution Points System (Months 1‚Äì2)

- Build contribution tracking system (task creation, points assignment, proof of work submission).
- Integrate with VIBES & STX token reward logic (manual payouts initially).
- Pilot rewards for first 20 contributors.
- Deliverable: Live contribution system MVP + first contributors rewarded.

Milestone 3 ‚Äì Web Interface & Automation (Months 3)

- Launch a user-facing web portal where contributors can track points, and claim rewards.
- Automate points-to-token distribution.
- Onboard community into first 1-2 flagship app builds.
- Deliverable: Public web interface + automated reward payouts live.

Milestone 4 ‚Äì App Launch & Flywheel Activation (Months 3‚Äì4)

- Ship MVPs of 1-2 flagship Bitcoin apps through the Vibes DAO process.
- Showcase shipped projects to spread the vibe and attract more builders.
- Fund additional contributor proposals via treasury to continue flywheel.
- Deliverable: 1 live Bitcoin app + proof of DAO-funded, community-built development cycle.

- DAO Infrastructure: The Vibes DAO MVP is already live with open-source code available at GitHub
- Marketing & Onboarding: We launched a dedicated landing page at vibesdao.fun to attract contributors and showcase the vision.

- Deliverable: A Stacks-native contribution and reward system integrated into the Vibes DAO platform. This system will include;

- Launch of at least one flagship Bitcoin app to demonstrate the system in action and showcase shipped projects on contributors‚Äô resumes.

- Allocate 20% of grant funds to the DAO Treasury (mini‚Äìdegrants model).
- Explain the transparent multisig system for payouts.
- Deliverable: Publicly documented DAO treasury with governance rules including a 7 day voting window.

issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:**‚Ää dantrevino@gmail.com
- **Twitter:**‚Ää @dantrevino
- **Main project/association:** Boom
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:** 
  * Former Stacks Resident  
  * Built the first NFT product on Stacks (Boom)  
  * SIP Contributor (SIP-016, proposed StacksPay)  

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚Ää‚ÄäLive the Bitcoin Economy through Boom using sBTC 
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):**‚Ää‚Ää $29700 USD
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):**  Complete infrastructure build out and launch of Boom.
- **Grant Audience:**‚Ää‚ÄäUsers, DeFi users, creators, merchants
- **Grant Team:**‚Ää@dantrevino, @r35h

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää

Empower seamless, secure Bitcoin and sBTC payments, peer-to-peer commerce, and developer-friendly integrations for everyone through an integrated wallet, Stripe-inspired payment API, decentralized marketplace, and privacy-first chat system that all leverage BNS.

- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää

Boom brings Bitcoin and sBTC into everyday use by enabling fast, low-fee peer-to-peer payments and borderless commerce in one platform. With 4,600+ early users, this grant will accelerate adoption, reduce merchant fees by over 90% versus Web2, drive real-world Bitcoin spending, and expand integration across partner apps.

- **Grant Risks:** 

Adoption & Liquidity - Risk: no critical mass of users/merchants ‚Üí marketplace stalls. Mitigation: zero-fee onboarding, limited number of early NFT lifetime-access passes, and direct partnerships to seed activity.

Security & Key Management - Risk: bugs, phishing, or lost keys erode trust. Mitigation: audits, built-in safety checks, in-app education, and simplified backup flows.

Regulatory & Competition - Risk: shifting rules or incumbents copying features. Mitigation: modular codebase for fast pivots, legal input, and differentiation via user-first design.

- **Traction:** 
  - 4,600+ preregistered users, live beta
  - 1000+ preregistered interested merchants (educators, creators and stores)
  - multiple community partnership commitments 
  (happy to show our registration list)

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

**Deliverables:**

- Boom Wallet (Core Deliverable) - Mobile app with email login, automatic Bitcoin + Stacks wallet creation, secure seed storage, and biometric access.
  - DeFi options via Bitflow
  - Stacking
  - NFT minting tools tied directly to Shops.
  - Decentralized marketplace and storefronts for digital + physical goods, integrated into the wallet.
  - Privacy-first wallet-to-wallet messaging for peer, group, and merchant support, built into the wallet experience.

- Ecosystem Onboarding - New BNS infrastructure, enabling faster, cheaper onboarding. Partnership with Let Africa Build, 300+ early merchant stores, and structured community education programs.

- Community Layer - Events, curated Bitcoin/crypto news feed, and open documentation to drive ecosystem adoption.
 
**Milestones:**

M1 - $13,000

- BNS installation complete
- Chat development complete
- Product listings, store profiles complete
- NFT mint contracts deployed & functional (nft minting)
- Full wallet options

M1 - Growth metrics:
 
- Closed beta with 50 users
- 100 buyer/seller messages
- 100 p2p messages
- 40 product listings
- 15 store fronts

M2 - $10,000
 
- in-app purchase flow complete
- shared/p2p purchase flow complete
- Establish web socket real-time connectivity
- Implement/update managed databases
- Deploy cloud-based image hosting
- Integrate AI-powered tools (e.g. Claude)
- Complete crypto API integrations
- Roll out cloud collaboration tools

M2 - Growth metrics
 
- 400 user activations
- 50 store fronts
- 100 product listings
- 500 in-app purchases

M3 - $7000
 
- Deploy dedicated Stacks/Bitcoin nodes
- Integrate IPFS storage
- Finalize and QA backend integrations
- Prepare scalability and monitoring tools
- Deliver ongoing bug fixes and infra improvements
- Infrastructure readiness assessment

M3 - Growth Metrics
 
- 1000 user activations
- 1000 in-app purchases

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks @dantrevino - a couple questions/asks for you! 

- We need to see dollar amounts associated to milestones. In addition, on the given milestones we need to see what success looks like at each such that the next milestone should be unlocked. Generally we want to see signs of traction at each milestone (i.e. x many new users, etc.) vs. binary 'we shipped X' because that tends to anchor us in impact (like user growth, feedback, TVL, etc.). I think given the base you already have this should be easy to project, thanks! 
- Generally, I'd like to better understand why it is important to include chat and features like that - it seems to me like what you have here is a core product based around peer-to-peer payments which in and of itself is a pretty major undertaking. Is there a route where you can cut costs by focusing on nailing that experience first and then expanding into the other features? Or are things like the 'Community Layer' absolutely critical in the early days for this to be successful? To my outside eye, it looks like there are items that could be labeled as 'nice to haves' relative the core use case, but I'm happy to have you explain that I'm wrong about it. 

If you can respond a bit for the committee and adjust the milestones a bit as noted in my first bullet, that'll help us continue reviewing. Thank you!

Thanks Dan, the committee met today and discussed. The consensus is that we want to see some kind of growth number in earlier Milestones. The general belief is that we can have testers and some folks kicking the tires on this well before M3 so that we can prove there is some interest and you're getting direct user feedback early and often. This can be a small cohort. With your stature in the community the waitlists you've mentioned, we believe this would be relatively straightforward for you - the idea here is to encourage shipping something usable as quickly as possible and then layer in additional features. 

This may not work for you, but one example we discussed was focusing first on the wallet to wallet messaging feature. What's the simplest way you could allow people to play with that today inside a web app or something? If you can rack up some message activity and people playing with it, it's easy to see demand and approve the rest which will rely on this feature (for the marketplace). A point of emphasis for our grants now and going forward is avoiding a 'build it and they will come' scenario where they don't come later and we're surprised by it. I'm happy to jump on a call with you and help you rework the milestones in real-time along this path. Ping me and we'll get it set asap!

  - Organized multiple workshops and meetups in San Francisco in collaboration with the Stacks Foundation.

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** PropertyX: A RWA Protocol on Stacks (https://pxrwa.xyz/)
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $60,000 USD
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Build and launch PropertyX V2 with staking, LP pools, and a tokenized offering for our first business client, delivering the first dividend to liquidity providers within six months.
- **Grant Audience:** _Developers, Founders, Users, DeFi Users, etc., please be as specific as you can_
  - DeFi users
  - Small and medium-sized business owners
  - Developers building RWA protocols
  - Community ambassadors to help with protocol promotion
- **Grant Team:** _List other members of your team here using their Github handles_
  - Binaya Tripathi: Founder and CEO (https://github.com/buildersacademyai/PropertyX )
  - Dipak Sharma: Blockchain Developer (https://github.com/0xdipak, Clarity, Rust Programmer)
  - Mahan Gurung: Clarity Developer (https://github.com/mahanGurung, PropertyX protocol developer)
  - Basanta Subedi: (https://github.com/Basanta11subedi Full Stack Developer)

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:** _Stated in 2-3 sentences_
  - PropertyX is about bringing real yield to Stacks by tokenizing future cash flows from profitable businesses like our first trucking client, moving away from the speculative yield of the current DeFi ecosystem. Unlike speculative DeFi, which rely on market guesses and whims, we‚Äôre tying actual revenue from profitable businesses to on-chain liquidity, and this grant will help us launch V2 with confidence in a compliant way.
- **Grant Impact:** _Stated in 2-3 sentences, what do you hope this grant does for the ecosystem? Think in terms of measurables and try to describe what has happened as a result of your grant being successful._
  - This grant will launch our first tokenized offering, roll out a platform for business tokenization, and deliver the first dividend to liquidity providers within six months. It‚Äôll put PropertyX on the map as a go-to for stable, business-backed real yields, something Stacks DeFi and DeFi in general desperately needs. PropertyX will inspire more RWA innovation in the ecosystem. Our successful V2 launch with dividends flowing back to LP providers will set the stage for VC funding to keep us growing strong.
- **Grant Risks:** _What are the primary things that can go wrong or reasons why the grant would not be successful? How do you plan to mitigate them?_
  - We‚Äôre stepping into new territory with RWAs, so regulatory hiccups could slow us down; we‚Äôre tackling that head-on with $20K from the grant for expert legal and tokenomics guidance. If a developer drops off, Builders Academy‚Äôs talent pipeline has us covered. Adoption might take time, but the buzz from our launch announcements gives us a solid start.
- **Traction:** _Please share any and all information you have related to the need or demand related to your grant request. Successful grant programs fuel projects that have some indication of need and/or product market fit. Please share data such as:_
     - _Active users:_ 1 business client (100K TVL) signed up for tokenization.
     - _Transaction volume:_ 200+ tx in MVP beta on testnet; more to come with mainnet launch.
     - _TVL:_ $100K from PropertyX‚Äôs first business client, with an additional $100K expected from the initial offering.
     - _Waitlist:_ No formal waitlist, but launch announcements have sparked tons of positive feedback on X (100+ likes/comments) for the upcoming product.

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:** _State what it is you will deliver specifically, i.e. a web interface for X, a mobile app, an SDK, a report, an event, whatever form it takes upon delivery._
  - PropertyX V2 with a mainnet launch, featuring staking, LP pools, dividend distribution, and an open platform for businesses to self-onboard onto our platform.
- **Milestones:** _If your grant request is for more than 10,000 USD or equivalent, please propose how your project can break down into milestones_
  - **Milestone 1 (Weeks 1-8, Oct-Nov 2025):** Nail down regulatory compliance with $20K for legal fees and kick off V2 development with $6K, including mainnet launch and tokenization for our first business client. We‚Äôll celebrate when that first offering hits the chain!
  - **Milestone 2 (Weeks 9-16, Dec-Jan 2026):** Set up contracts for token staking and LP pools for incentives, then distribute the first dividend to liquidity providers through the protocol. Budget: $12K for testing/development, $5K for marketing and awareness to spread the word.
  - **Milestone 3 (Weeks 17-24, Feb-Mar 2026):** Open the platform for any business to self-onboard to our tokenization platform. We will launch our final platform, PropertyX, a hub for real yield tokenization. Budget: $17K (Development, ops, marketing, and final polish to ensure a smooth rollout).

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks @binayatripathi - RWAs are certainly an area of intrigue so I'm happy to see this. A few questions as we review:

- Have you had conversations about a proper fundraise? Candidly, my fear is that an effort like this is much more capital intensive than any grant I could provide would allow for. 
- Next, where is the $20,000 in legal fees coming from, is that a quote you received? It's generally difficult for us to directly fund things that cover others legal fees so we should consider how to restructure the application some.
- Have you budgeted for an audit (or some version of a deep, deep check on contracts holding user funds)?
- What will the liquidity requirements of the protocol be? Is the grant intended to cover incentives for LPs? Sort of back to my first point, something like this would likely be pretty capital intensive to bootstrap so I'm trying to plan ahead such that we don't fund a build that we can't ultimately support growth for. 
- Last, I'd like to see the milestones be reworked around impact or traction. i.e. your first Milestone has this by referencing the 1 business client on mainnet - the other milestones should be done similarly so we have a shared view of whether or not this is working and can unlock further funding.

cuevasm_comments.body:
Hey @binayatripathi - we're still looking forward to hearing a bit more related to my questions above. However, we met today and discussed your grant in detail. Here's what we'd be ready to approve:

- The initial milestone of $26,000 (20,000 legal) under two conditions (1) that this legal expense is turned into a published document/framework and 'open-sourced' for the community. There are other RWA efforts in the ecosystem and so for this grant, we want to be sure it benefits as many builders as possible. (2) that you source multiple bids for this work before deciding on a provider.
- From there, our opinion is that the grant doesn't request enough relative to the actual cost of bootstrapping this business model and to fully fund something like this is beyond the means of this program. To that end we want the initial milestone approval to give you some time to keeping working in the short-term, getting you past the first legal hurdle while we support you in a proper fundraise through our network. This is something I'll personally drive with an initial set of introductions in the ecosystem and something our grant committee member, Jonathan Sadlowe, can help directly with as well (he's a VC). Our rational is this: In addition to some of the things you've listed, you will need to be able to pay for things like audits, whitehats, custody providers, listings (and the many costs associated with those including a KOL plan, lawyers, etc., a whole lot for bootstrapping some initial liquidity, and many more expenses both predictable and unpredictable. We believe you're ready to take this step and it would be necessary to position PropertyX for success - if success happens fast, you'll want to have the funding on hand to lean into growth and so a round here would be great.

For now, please confirm whether you accept the terms from item 1 and then please setup some time with me to discuss the fundraising suggestion: https://calendly.com/mitchellcuevas

issues.body:
üôÇ Applicant Information
Email: mark@dataing.io
Twitter: @MarkKilaghbian

Main project/association: Dataing Data Marketplace & DID ‚Äî an sBTC‚Äënative marketplace for privacy‚Äëpreserving, cohort‚Äëlevel social + conversational datasets; seeded by Dataing, our live AI matchmaker app.

Notable ecosystem achievements or impact (limit 3):
Active Stacks/Bitcoin builder (Bitcoin Pepe dev, @PepeCoinSTX).

Host of Cryptoconomy (long‚Äërunning Bitcoin/crypto podcast).

Universal Basic Data Income co‚Äëfounder/executive (consumer data monetization; ~100k users; acquired).

Grant Overview
Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC): $25,000

Grant Goal: Launch an sBTC‚Äënative data marketplace where vetted buyers pay in sBTC for de‚Äëidentified, cohort‚Äëlevel datasets (with on‚Äëchain license‚Äëreceipt NFTs) and where buyers and consumer suppliers can opt‚Äëin to stake for sBTC rewards funded by marketplace fees.

Grant Audience: AI labs & researchers; consumers look for love or extra income; consumer‚Äëresearch teams; Stacks builders integrating DID/consent receipts.

Grant Team:
Mark Kilaghbian ‚Äî Founder (product/BD; Cryptoconomy; ex‚ÄëUBDI; dev @PepeCoinSTX)
Leo Gharib ‚Äî CTO (iOS/web; wallets; founder of Runes TCG; ex‚ÄëShore Crypto)
Eric McHugh ‚Äî Head of Growth (co‚Äëfounder, Aces.fun / RWA)
Madeline ‚ÄúMads‚Äù Talt ‚Äî Marketing (ex‚ÄëHalo Top, OLIPOP; UBDI alum)
Ara ‚Äî Data/ML pipelines (cohorts, semantics, k‚Äëanon/DP)
Emily ‚Äî Brand & marketing (positioning, buyer outreach)
Hank Uberoi ‚Äî Investor (Prev. COO @ Citadel)

Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction:

Grant Mission
Dataing turns opt‚Äëin, holistic user signals (social accounts, activity logs, and conversation‚Äëlevel semantics) into privacy‚Äëpreserving cohort datasets buyers can purchase in sBTC. We add DID/consent receipts so rights are clear on‚Äëchain, and opt‚Äëin staking so both buyers and suppliers can earn sats‚Äëback from marketplace fees (rewards, not guaranteed yield).

Grant Impact
We‚Äôll demonstrate consumer‚Äëgrade sBTC commerce: fee‚Äësponsored sBTC checkout, SIP‚Äë009 license‚Äëreceipt NFTs, and measurable BTC‚Äëdenominated GMV. Open‚Äësourcing contracts + SDK (consent receipts, sBTC splits, staking vaults) gives the Stacks ecosystem reusable primitives for data licensing, DID, and sats‚Äësettled payouts.

Grant Risks (and mitigations)
Privacy/regulatory: Only aggregates leave the enclave; k‚Äëanon + optional DP; hash‚Äëanchored consent logs; deletion/on‚Äëoff toggles.

Cold start & fee friction: Seed SKUs from Dataing; pilot buyers lined up; fee sponsorship for smooth sBTC UX; fallback to AMM sBTC‚áÑSTX routing if sponsors congest (trade‚Äëoffs documented).

Cross‚Äëchain competition (Solana): Our edge is bitcoin settlement and richer, holistic signals (incl. 10+ Social sources + consented chat semantics) vs. media‚Äëonly pools.

Traction (what we can share now):
Active users: App live on iOS + web; public iOS listing shows v1.0.10 (Sep 4, 2025) and 4.5
Transaction volume: Pre‚Äëmarketplace (sBTC commerce begins with this grant).
TVL: Will begin with staking vaults at Milestone 2.

Waitlist: 1,500

üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

Deliverable (what we will ship):
A production‚Äëready sBTC‚Äënative Data Marketplace & DID kit: contracts (consent‚Äëreceipt NFTs, sBTC splits, staking vaults), buyer checkout in sBTC (fee‚Äësponsored), 3 seed SKUs, Supplier SDK, and public docs/examples.
Milestone 1 ‚Äî sBTC Checkout, Receipts & Seed SKUs (Oct‚ÄìNov 2025) ‚Äî 0.085 BTC (sBTC)

Contracts:
consent-receipt.clar ‚Äî SIP‚Äë009 license receipts (terms‚Äëhash + SKU id)
sats-split.clar ‚Äî sBTC fee splits (suppliers / buyer‚Äërewards / platform)

UX: Xverse/Leather connect; fee‚Äësponsored sBTC checkout; 10+ Social Data Sources 

Docs/Tools: ‚ÄúBuy with sats‚Äù guide; CLI to verify receipts.

Milestone 2 ‚Äî Staking Rewards & Supplier SDK (Nov‚ÄìDec 2025) ‚Äî 0.090 BTC (sBTC)
Vaults: Buyer & Supplier staking‚Äëvault contracts; epoch accounting; sats‚Äëback from fee pool (variable, not guaranteed).
Supplier SDK: Publish aggregates (not raw PII); set split shares; cohort builder UI.
Marketplace UI: SKU catalog; receipts; downloads; public methodology cards.

Milestone 3 ‚Äî Trust, Metrics & BTC Off‚Äëramp (Dec 2025‚ÄìJan 2026) ‚Äî 0.045 BTC (sBTC)
Auditability: Public receipt‚Äëverification tool; license watermarking.
Metrics: Live dashboard (sBTC GMV, orders, repeat buyers, staking TVL, supplier payouts).
GTM: Onboard 10 pilot buyers (AI labs, advertisers, researchers); publish launch report with GMV & retention.

Total: 0.22 BTC (sBTC) (‚âà $25,000 equivalent)

What Dataing is / does (supply engine)
AI matchmaker (iOS + web) that pairs people without swiping; CupidAI learns from opt‚Äëin social signals and preferences. dataing.io / beta.dataing.io

Holistic, consented signals: profile traits & evidence; conversation‚Äëlevel semantics (who initiates, sentiment/intent, follow‚Äëthrough); plus connectors (X, TikTok, Pinterest, YouTube, Apple Music, Google Calendar, Eventbrite, camera roll, location).

Marketplace converts these signals into privacy‚Äëpreserving cohorts priced in sBTC.

Why now (market proof)

Solana comps: Kled shows strong consumer appetite to sell data for crypto (claimed ~10k downloads in two days). We meet this demand in bitcoin (sBTC) and with higher‚Äësignal consented datasets.
Big Tech data race: High‚Äëquality training data is scarce; platforms are moving to license/activate their own pools.
Why sBTC: Fee sponsorship (no STX needed), Xverse/Leather wallet support, and withdrawals to BTC give buyers a clean bitcoin‚Äëdenominated flow end‚Äëto‚Äëend.

What we‚Äôre shipping (sBTC first)
Buy in sBTC ‚Äî one‚Äëclick, sats‚Äëdenominated checkout; SIP‚Äë009 license‚Äëreceipt NFT per purchase.
Stake to earn sBTC (opt‚Äëin) ‚Äî fee‚Äëfunded rewards for buyers and suppliers (variable, not guaranteed); optional, disclosed routing to vetted sBTC DeFi (off by default).
DID & Consent ‚Äî on‚Äëchain consent receipts; optional BNS/DID linking; supplier‚Äëside logs.

Open‚ÄëSource Plan
Clarity contracts (MIT): consent-receipt.clar, sats-split.clar, staking-vaults.clar (+ example SIP‚Äë009/SIP‚Äë010 integrations).

JS/TS SDK (MIT):
Buyer: buySkuWithSats(), verifyReceipt(), downloadAggregate()
Staking: stakeBuyerSats(), stakeSupplierSats(), claimRewards()
Supplier: publishAggregate(), setSplitShares()
Wallet helpers for Xverse/Leather; fee sponsorship examples.

## üôÇ Applicant Information
- **Email:** DeOrganizedShow@gmail.com
- **Twitter:** @PeaceLoveMusicG @DeOrganizedBTC
- **Main project/association:** DeOrganized Media ‚Äì daily Bitcoin + Stacks ecosystem media platform
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
  - Produced 200+ live shows in 2025, averaging 1,200 daily live viewers, amplifying builders, SIPs, DeGrants, and governance.
  - Supported adoption and growth for Stacks-native projects through coverage, sponsorships, and partnerships (e.g. StackingDAO, Bitflow, Zero Authority DAO, BoostX, Skullcoin, ROO, LEO, fak.fun, BigMarket.ai).
  - Governance CAB member & SIP Deputy, hosting weekly Stacks Improvement & Innovation livestream.

---

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** DeOrganized Ecosystem Continuity & Expansion
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** ~$32,000
- **Grant Ask:** $20,000
- **GGrant Goal (in one sentence): Sustain DeOrganized Media‚Äôs role as an independent media arm for the Stacks ecosystem by funding continuity operations and driving multi-channel audience growth and engagement through the end of 2025.
- **Grant Audience:** Stacks builders, governance participants, DeFi & SocialFi users, investors, and Bitcoin-focused communities.
- **Grant Team:** 
  - PeaceLoveMusic.btc (Stephen Perrino): Host, Founder, SIP Deputy, CAB Member
  - GPSC.btc: Co-host, Head of Operations
  - 3HunnatheArtist.btc: Co-host, Head of Content
  - Web3Binta: Co-host, Head of Guest Scheduling
  - PLord: Social Media Lead
  - Ambassadors: Bolupeak, 0XN0sferatu, PrinceKay, WenyuWevaHazel

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

### Grant Mission

DeOrganized Media amplifies Stacks builders, governance, and adoption through daily programming, news coverage, and live engagement. This grant ensures continuity of proven operations while expanding distribution across multiple channels to grow ecosystem visibility.

### Grant Impact

By December 2025, the Stacks community will continue to benefit from daily live coverage, weekly SIP & Innovation livestreams, and consistent short-form distribution across TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and X. These efforts will expand reach and engagement across multiple channels, driving measurable growth in impressions, audience participation, and ecosystem visibility. Early website upgrades (Calendar v1 and basic content tools) remain part of the broader roadmap, improving discoverability of events and content as complementary funding allows. A points-system concept doc will establish the foundation for incentivizing participation and sponsor-aligned behaviors.

Beyond this grant cycle, DeOrganized is building toward sustainability through sponsorships and content/distribution contracts. We‚Äôve already secured partners such as StackingDAO and Bitflow, and our long-term plan is to expand these partnerships and add new revenue models. This positions DeOrganized to reduce reliance on grants while continuing to provide independent, trusted media coverage for the Stacks ecosystem.

### Grant Risks

* **Overextension:** Scope creep could dilute delivery. *Mitigation ‚Üí narrowed MVP scope focused on achievable, high-impact growth.*
* **Platform Reliance:** Viewer engagement depends on X and YouTube distribution. *Mitigation ‚Üí diversify into TikTok and Instagram.*
* **Financial Sustainability:** Operations depend on co-funding. *Mitigation ‚Üí ongoing sponsorships (StackingDAO, Bitflow) and partnerships (Zero Authority DAO, BoostX, BNS.one, Skullcoin, fak.fun, BigMarket.ai).*

### Traction

* **Active users:** 800‚Äì1,200 daily live show viewers; 3,000+ weekly unique participants
* **Transaction volume:** N/A (media-first project)
* **TVL:** N/A (media-first project)
* **Waitlist:** None ‚Äî audience access is live and open
* **Additional Indicators:** ~250,000 monthly impressions (3-month average) and over 126,000 live viewers (past 6 months); partnerships with StackingDAO, Bitflow, Zero Authority DAO, BoostX, BNS.one, Skullcoin, fak.fun, BigMarket.ai; approved press access for Bitcoin 2025; sustained audience growth since launch

---

## üí∞ Budget Narrative

**Total Project Budget (Oct‚ÄìDec 2025): ~$32,000**

* Founder Continuity Stipend: $15,000
* Team Support Pool: $6,000
* Apps & Services: $3,000
* Audience Growth & Promotion: $2,000
* Phase 1 Website v2 (calendar + early content tools): $4,000‚Äì$6,000

**Grant Ask:** $20,000 (to cover core operations, team stipends, and tools)

**Co-Funding Sources:** ~$12,000 expected from sponsorships, partnerships, and DeGrants to support Phase 1 website development and promotional activities.

---

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Milestones

**Funding Structure:**

* $5,000 upfront to support ongoing operations and baseline deliverables.
* $5,000 released upon successful completion of milestones at each checkpoint.

### Deliverables & Outcomes (Ongoing)

* ~72 daily shows, ~60 news threads, weekly SIP & Innovation livestream coverage, and event coverage.
* On-chain participation: Publish a points-system concept doc outlining an audience rewards framework to incentivize participation and sponsor/partner-aligned behaviors.
* Early website upgrades: Calendar v1 + basic content tools.
* 10+ short-form clips per month on YouTube Shorts/TikTok.

‚û°Ô∏è **Each milestone represents both continuity of programming and measurable growth in audience reach and engagement, while also tracking directional traffic to Stacks ecosystem destinations (wallets, Ascent, SIP/forum, events).**

---

### Milestone 1 ‚Äî October 2025 ($5,000 upon completion)

* Deliverables: Daily shows/news threads; weekly SIP livestream coverage; short-form clips.
* Outcomes: Establish baseline growth tracking across TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, X, and Discord. **Implement outbound click tracking (UTMs/Bitly) to measure traffic driven to key ecosystem pages (wallet installs, Stacks Ascent, SIP/forum discussions, events) and set a CTR baseline.**
* Growth Targets:

  * TikTok: 1,600 views ‚Ä¢ 200 reached ‚Ä¢ 20 engagements ‚Ä¢ 75 followers
  * Instagram: 2,800 views ‚Ä¢ 2,800 accounts reached ‚Ä¢ 75 followers
  * YouTube: 5,000 views ‚Ä¢ 70 watch hours ‚Ä¢ +10 subs
  * X: 290K impressions ‚Ä¢ 18K engagements ‚Ä¢ +75 followers
  * Discord: 110 members ‚Ä¢ 10 active participants

---

### Milestone 2 ‚Äî November 2025 ($5,000 upon completion)

* Deliverables: Daily shows/news threads; weekly SIP livestream coverage; expanded short-form distribution.
* Outcomes: Continue audience growth across channels. **Report first directional traffic results (CTR and total clicks) and target 10‚Äì15% growth over M1 baseline.**
* Growth Targets:

  * TikTok: 2,000 views ‚Ä¢ 300 reached ‚Ä¢ 30 engagements ‚Ä¢ 120 followers
  * Instagram: 3,500 views ‚Ä¢ 3,500 accounts reached ‚Ä¢ 120 followers
  * YouTube: 6,000 views ‚Ä¢ 85 watch hours ‚Ä¢ +15 subs
  * X: 330K impressions ‚Ä¢ 20K engagements ‚Ä¢ +125 followers
  * Discord: 140 members ‚Ä¢ 20 active participants

---

### Milestone 3 ‚Äî December 2025 ($5,000 upon completion)

* Deliverables: Daily shows/news threads; weekly SIP livestream coverage; year-in-review programming; publish points-system concept doc.
* Outcomes: Sustain audience growth across all channels. **Provide cumulative directional traffic report and target 10‚Äì15% growth in CTR and total clicks over M1 baseline.**
* Growth Targets:

  * TikTok: 2,500 views ‚Ä¢ 400 reached ‚Ä¢ 40 engagements ‚Ä¢ 175 followers
  * Instagram: 4,300 views ‚Ä¢ 4,300 accounts reached ‚Ä¢ 175 followers
  * YouTube: 7,500 views ‚Ä¢ 100 watch hours ‚Ä¢ +20 subs
  * X: 375K impressions ‚Ä¢ 22K engagements ‚Ä¢ +200 followers
  * Discord: 175 members ‚Ä¢ 30 active participants

This would help us understand better how these things are trending and their impact vs simply that we got them done. We do the same thing with each of our efforts, we don't measure how many developer events we do, we measure how many developers we onboarded to programs and I'd like to see these milestones/deliverables reframed similarly. 

Thank you!
