## :page_with_curl: Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** ‚ÄäBoostX: Roadmap Completion & Ecosystem Scaling
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):**‚Ää‚Ää$15,000 USD equivalent in STX (‚âà25,000 STX @ $0.60)
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Deliver the remaining BoostX milestones (Leaderboards, Profile Integrations, BNS Badges, Tweet Stats, NFT Tabs, Notifications) to move from ‚Äúfunctional MVP‚Äù into a network-effect growth phase.
- **Grant Audience:**‚Ää‚ÄäUsers on X & Discord, community builders, NFT projects, SocialFi developers, and ambassadors driving sBTC/STX adoption.
- **Grant Team:**‚Ää‚Ää
  - cryptodude.btc ([X](https://x.com/cryptodude_btc) & [Github](https://github.com/cryptocracy)) 
  - cryptosmith.btc ([X](https://x.com/cryptosmith_btc) & [Github](https://github.com/Zeus-Adin))

## :rocket: Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää BoostX is building the connective tissue between Stacks wallets, tokens, and social platforms like X & Discord. This grant will let us finish high-impact roadmap features that turn BoostX into a ‚Äúdefault interface‚Äù for token based engagement, discovery, and onboarding.
- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäCompleting leaderboards, featured profiles, and additional integrations will increase daily engagement, give visibility to builders, and incentivize new user onboarding. BoostX already routes real transaction flow (Boosts, Space Drops, & NFT transfers) finishing these milestones expands measurable onchain activity, user retention, and ecosystem visibility.

- **Grant Risks:** 
  -   Risk: X/Discord UI changes breaking injections -> Mitigation: modular content scripts + rapid patch deployment.
 
  -   Risk: Lower adoption of new features (leaderboards, badges) -> Mitigation: incentivize via referral system and highlight featured dApps/artists.
 
  -   Risk: Latency or API hiccups on stats endpoints -> Mitigation: retry logic + Redis caching.

- **Traction:** 
   - 140 active extension installations per Chrome Webstore   
   - 1730 Boosts & 255 Space Drops, w/ 43 supported tokens and 35 featured dapps.
   - 7,475.91 STX, 0.005186 sBTC, 873.5 USDh +Millions of More tokens sent already via BoostX.

## :motorway: Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:**‚Ää 
A fully upgraded BoostX extension + website, completing outstanding milestones and delivering ecosystem-scale visibility (leaderboards, profiles, badges, stats overlays, native notifications).

:white_check_mark: Milestones Completed (history of work since Feb 2025):
- Wallet connectivity for X & Discord
- Integration with Leather, Xverse, Asigna
- Expanded namespaces (.btc, .stx, .id + more)
- Support for 43 fungible tokens (STX, sBTC, USDh, etc.)
- Boosting for Tweets & Discord messages
- Space Drops via X Spaces (with conditional eligibility + list mgmt)
- Boosting for Live Broadcasts
- Featured dApps module (36 dApps)
- NFT transfers inside Boosting
- Referral & Sponsor systems (onchain revenue splits)
- Exchange rate display in modals
- Omni search field (BNS -> X profile)

## To Be Completed with This Grant:

### Milestone 1: Leaderboards, ZeroAuthority Integration & Notifications

**Deliverables:**
- Leaderboard module (extension + website)
- ZeroAuthority API integrated for Submitters list in Space Drops
- Migration to browser-native notifications

**Growth Targets:** 
- Installs: ‚â• 250 
- Transactions: ‚â• 3,000 cumulative Boost/SpaceDrop transactions

- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäTo empower AI enthusiasts in the Stacks ecosystem to learn advanced tools, collaboratively create AI-empowered content and codes, and earn rewards through community-driven bounties and Stacks projects partnerships.

- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää
     - By equipping community members with AI skills, the Stacks AI Guild acts as an AI-powered social layer that enables builders to create engaging content such as professional videos, animations, short clips, polished graphics, memes, and tutorials that amplify marketing, boost awareness across social platforms, drive awareness and adoption of Stacks projects.

     - It also serves as a learning hub for AI developers, identify gaps in the ecosystem, build useful tools, rapidly prototype apps, shorten the path from MVP to GTM, and contribute to ecosystem enhancements.
  
     - By supporting community members' AI tools subscriptions, we would unlock their creativity to build and increase the rate of experimentations, output and productivity.

     - In effect, the Stacks AI Guild becomes a focused AI layer that strengthens Stacks by attracting and retaining AI-driven community members, increasing productive activity, and positioning Stacks as the hub where AI and Bitcoin innovation meet.

- **Grant Risks:** 
     - Low adoption if AI tools prove too complex for newcomers, mitigated by beginner-friendly guides and personal touches such as educational screen shares and 1:1 classes .

     - Content quality dilution from rapid creation, managed through moderation and bounty criteria.
     - Dependency on platforms like X for traction, other social platform for community building like discord so we can always retain our community members and outreach.

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** Stacks Wars Growth Scheme  
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $32,000  
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Sustain and expand Stacks Wars over the next 12 months by delivering new games, a mobile app, and community-driven tournaments that drive measurable on-chain activity.  
- **Grant Audience:** Gamers (both casual and competitive), Web3 users, and developers who want to contribute games to the platform.  
- **Grant Team:**  
  - [@iflames_1](https://x.com/iflames_1) - Founder, Developer  
  - [@iatomic_1](https://x.com/iatomic_1) - Developer

  - [@Hikmahcodes](https://x.com/Hikmahcodes) - Social Media Manager

  - [@ID_CRYPTO12](https://x.com/ID_CRYPTO12) - Ambassador  
  - [@Hazybtc](https://x.com/Hazybtc) - Community Moderator  

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**  
  Stacks Wars‚Äô mission is to bridge Web2 gamers into the Stacks ecosystem by building engaging, skill-based, on-chain games with real rewards. Over the next year, we aim to scale the platform with new games, improved UX, and tournaments that highlight the utility of GameFi as a growth engine for the Stacks blockchain.  

- **Grant Impact:**  
  This grant will help expand Stacks Wars by funding new games, launching a mobile app, and running tournaments that create measurable on-chain activity. Our events will bring real adoption, while our planned open-source engine will allow external developers to build and monetize their own games within Stacks Wars.  

- **Grant Risks:**  
  - **Low adoption risk:** If users don‚Äôt engage consistently, growth may stall.  
    *Mitigation:* Host recurring tournaments, sponsor events, and build social hooks like leaderboards.  
  - **Technical risk:** Scaling multiplayer infra and smart contracts.  
    *Mitigation:* Phased rollout, active testing, and audits before major launches.  

- **Traction:**  
  - **Active users:** 117 players connected during testnet, 19 active players since mainnet launch (Sept 22).  
  - **Transaction volume:** 1,000+ transactions during Lexi Wars testnet.  
  - **Community size:** 170+ members in Telegram.  
  - **Events:** First mainnet bounty competition live (‚ÄúCreate a lobby with the most users‚Äù).  
  - **MVP:** Mainnet launched Sept 22 ‚Äî [Leaderboard here](https://www.stackswars.com/leaderboard).  

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverables:**  
  - Launch 3 additional games on Stacks Wars  
  - Release mobile app for onboarding and retention  
  - Host recurring tournaments and community-driven events  
  - Open-source game engine + documentation for developers to contribute mini-games  

- **Milestones & Funding Unlocks:**  
  Each milestone will unlock a **$8,000 grant tranche** upon completion.  

  **Q4 2025 (Sept‚ÄìDec)**  
  - Mainnet rollout ‚úÖ (already live, Sept 22)  
  - Launch second game (Stacks Sweepers) üöß in progress  
  - Host first bounty event (‚ÄúCreate a lobby with the most users‚Äù)  
  - **Milestone:** Deliver **Stacks Sweepers** by end of Q4 ‚Üí unlock $8k  

  **Q1 2026**  
  - UI redesign for improved UX  
  - Host community events  
  - Begin development of third game  
  - **Milestone:** Launch **new UI redesign** ‚Üí unlock $8k  

  **Q2 2026**  
  - Continue development of third game
  - Host bounty/community tournaments
  - Begin mobile app beta (internal testing)
  - **Milestone:** Deliver playable version of third game (beta) ‚Üí unlock $8k

  **Q3 2026**  
  - Official launch of third game with seasonal content
  - Expanded tournament schedule
  - Make game engine developer-friendly with tutorials/docs to onboard external devs
  - Mobile app release (public launch with seasonal content)
  - **Milestone:** Public release of game engine + tutorials/docs ‚Üí unlock $8k

---

## üí∞ Budget Summary
- **Total Request:** $32,000  
- **Structure:** $8k per milestone (4 tranches)  
- **Use of funds:** Development, infra, events/tournaments, community growth.  

---

### Notes
We agree with the committee‚Äôs recommendation to make milestones leaner and tied to delivery. We‚Äôve already proven MVP adoption (mainnet live Sept 22 with active users). Each funding tranche will be tied to measurable outcomes, reducing risk.  

We also plan to open-source the engine so game developers can contribute directly and retain fees generated from their games.

     - Built comprehensive multi-wallet integration supporting Hiro, Leather, Xverse, and Asigna wallets with advanced conflict resolution
     - Developed production-ready Clarity smart contracts with full CRUD operations for developer profiles and reputation tracking
     - Created a sophisticated wallet provider detection and session management system that solves common ecosystem integration challenges

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäStacksBuilder: Scaling Developer Talent Discovery in the Stacks Ecosystem
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):**‚Ää‚Ää$15,000 USD (or equivalent in STX)
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Launch and scale StacksBuilder as the premier platform for Stacks developers to showcase their work, build reputation, and connect with opportunities in the Bitcoin L2 ecosystem.
- **Grant Audience:**‚ÄäStacks developers, Bitcoin L2 builders, hiring companies, project founders, and ecosystem stakeholders seeking technical talent
- **Grant Team:**‚Ää‚Ää [odeyemitobi](https://github.com/odeyemitobi) (Lead Developer & Founder)

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäStacksBuilder addresses the critical gap in developer talent discovery within the Stacks ecosystem by providing a professional platform where developers can showcase their Bitcoin L2 projects, build verifiable on-chain reputation, and connect with opportunities. The platform serves as both a portfolio showcase and a talent marketplace specifically designed for the unique needs of the Stacks/Bitcoin development community.
- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäThis grant will enable StacksBuilder to become the go-to platform for developer talent in the Stacks ecosystem, directly supporting ecosystem growth by making it easier for companies to find qualified developers and for developers to demonstrate their expertise. Success will result in 100+ developer profiles within 6 months, 20+ companies using the platform for hiring, and a measurable increase in developer retention and project collaboration within the ecosystem.
- **Grant Risks:**  Primary risks include developer adoption challenges and competition from existing platforms. Mitigation strategies include:  
     - Direct integration with existing Stacks developer communities and events. 
     - Unique value proposition through on-chain reputation and Bitcoin L2 focus. 
     - Partnership with ecosystem organizations for promotion and validation. 
     - Comprehensive wallet integration that reduces friction for Stacks developers already familiar with the ecosystem.

- **Traction:** 
     - _Active users:_ Platform is in the development phase with fully functional smart contracts deployed on testnet
     - _Transaction volume:_ Smart contracts successfully tested with profile creation, updates, and verification transactions
     - _TVL:_ N/A (not applicable for developer showcase platform)
     - _Waitlist:_ Platform addresses frequently discussed need for better developer discovery in Stacks community channels and developer forums

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:**‚Ää 
     - Production deployment on mainnet with audited smart contracts
     - Comprehensive developer onboarding system
     - Company/recruiter interface for talent discovery
     - Integration with major Stacks ecosystem events and communities
     - Analytics dashboard for ecosystem insights

- **Milestones:** 
     - Milestone 1 ($5,000): Mainnet deployment and security audit of smart contracts, platform launch with core features, initial developer onboarding campaign targeting 25+ profiles
     - Milestone 2 ($5,000): Company/recruiter interface development, integration with 3+ ecosystem partners, achievement of 50+ developer profiles, and 5+ companies actively using the platform
     - Milestone 3 ($5,000): Advanced features (project collaboration tools, reputation algorithms, ecosystem analytics), achievement of 100+ profiles and 15+ companies, comprehensive documentation and API for ecosystem integrations

issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:**‚Ää bowtiedsirjonathan@gmail.com
- **Main project/association:** [DegenLab](http://degenlab.io/)
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:** 
-  https://bitcoinismore.org/
-  https://stacking.tools/ 
-  https://pool.degenlab.io/
## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää Stacks Mobile App: Web2 UX, Web3 Growth
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):**‚Ää‚Ää $74,250
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Make Stacks adoption feel natural to everyday mobile users, blending familiar Web2 modules (Google login, ads, minigames, referrals) with seamless Web3 functionality like wallet creation, stacking, and transactions.
- **Grant Audience:** Mobile users, and developers (see SDK)
- **Grant Team:**
  - @bowtiedblox
  - @bowtiedbot
  - @bowtieddiego
  - @bowtiedsirjonathan
  - @bowtiedandrew

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäOur goal is to make Stacks feel usable for everyday mobile users who consider Web3 too complex to interact with. If someone can log in with Google, play a game, or watch an ad and instantly have a working wallet that just ‚Äúfeels like an app,‚Äù then we‚Äôve succeeded. From there, we want to guide users step by step into stacking and holding tokens, without forcing them through seed phrases, exchanges, or confusing flows.
- **Grant Impact:** It intends to bring in new users who wouldn‚Äôt normally interact with the Stacks blockchain at all. In practical terms, that means thousands of wallets created through simple onboarding, users generating transactions every day just by playing and claiming rewards, and at least some of them moving into stacking. The SDK would let other developers reuse the same login + wallet system.

- **Grant Risks:** The app not having the expected impact. This should be handled by promoting the app before being launched. We intend to attract Web2 users mainly through the app's gamification process.
- **Traction:**  -

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverables:**‚Ää 
  - Integration of google login in Leather mobile wallet
    - Secure wallet backup and cross-device recovery.
  - SDK that lets other developers use Google-based onboarding and wallet features in their apps
  - Mobile app with Google login and automatic Stacks wallet creation.
    - Reward system with minigames, ads, referrals.
    - Ad-sponsored transaction flow to keep UX Web2-like.
    - In-app stacking and token purchase.
    - Integration of stacking, sBTC yield and DeFi protocols.

## Milestones
### Milestone 1: Seamless Onboarding & Wallet Integration in Leather Mobile App

**Duration:** 135 hours - 3.5 weeks

**Budget:**¬†$12,150

**Outcome:**

- Users can authenticate with Google, automatically receive a secure non-custodial Stacks wallet, and restore their wallet across devices without handling private keys.

**Deliverables:**

- **Authentication & Wallet Setup** - 45h
    - Implement mobile app shell (iOS + Android).
    - Integrate Google OAuth2 login flow.
    - Encrypt mnemonic with the user‚Äôs chosen password/biometric and store it in Google Drive (`appDataFolder`).
- **Wallet Recovery** - 30h
    - Implement cross-device wallet restoration.
    - Test reinstall/recovery flows for resilience.
- **Scalability & Security** - 60h
    - Validate encryption scheme for wallet backup.
    - Conduct penetration testing of login/restore pipeline.

**Expected traction:**

- ~200 users minimum first couple of weeks.

**Purpose:**

- Establish the foundation, validate core functionality, and confirm early interest.
---
### Milestone 2: Multi-App SDK & Ecosystem Integration

**Duration:** 175 hours - 4.5 weeks

**Budget:**¬†$15,750

**Outcome:**

- Expand adoption with an SDK that lets other developers use Google-based onboarding and wallet features in their apps.
- Enable one Google account **‚Üí** one wallet across multiple apps.
- Integrate the SDK into:
    - Leather extension
    - Xverse app and extension

**Deliverables:**

- **SDK Development** - 50h
    - Provide APIs for core functionality:
        - `loginWithGoogle()`
        - `getAddress()`
        - `getBalance()`
        - `sendTransaction()`
        - `contractCall()`
        - `stack()`
- **Cross-App Continuity** - 40h
    - Standardize wallet retrieval/decryption from Google Drive.
    - Ensure one Google account = one wallet across applications.
- **Developer Resources** - 40h
    - Publish documentation, code samples, and integration guides.
    - Provide reference implementations.
- **Scalability & Security** - 45h
    - Test wallet retrieval across multiple apps and devices.
    - Validate SDK signing logic and prevent unauthorized key access.

**Expected traction:**

- Allow DeFi protocol access through Gmail, 1000 wallets minimum using these features.

**Purpose:**

- Open the door for all Leather/Xverse users to connect with Google across apps (e.g. Zest pools, Bitflow swaps), ensuring the feature is actively used in real scenarios.

--- 
### Milestone 3: Incentivized Engagement & Reward Loops

**Duration:** 240 hours - 6 weeks

**Budget:**¬†$21,600

**Outcome:**

- Users engage daily through minigames, ads, referrals, and streaks, earning real STX rewards. Transaction costs are abstracted via ad-sponsored transactions, maintaining a Web2-like experience.

**Deliverables:**

- **Game Module** - 60h
    - Implement lightweight minigame prototype (e.g., endless tapper/runner).
    - Design reward conversion formula (score ‚Üí points).
    - Points can be converted to in-game power-ups/upgrades.
    - Implement cooldown/anti-abuse checks.
- **Ad & Transaction Sponsorship Module** - 60h
    - Integrate AdMob/Unity Ads SDK.
    - Implement ad-view reward flow.
    - Develop backend to prepare sponsored transactions; user signs locally after watching ads.
- **Engagement Layer** - 80h
    - Define reward tiers (Bronze/Silver/Gold) with multipliers.
        - Tiers influence daily/weekly reward rates.
    - Build referral system (unique codes, backend mappings, anti-fraud).
        - Each user receives a unique referral code.
        - New users who sign up with a referral code get points bonus.
        - Referrers earn a percentage bonus when their referees engage.
    - Implement daily streak tracking with escalating rewards.
- **Scalability & Security** - 40h
    - Load testing of ad-based reward flows.
    - Fraud detection for referrals and abuse prevention.
    - Validate streak progression and reset logic.

**Expected traction:**

- ~500 new users first month minimum.

**Purpose:**

- Bring in Web2 audiences through a low-friction, engaging entry point - expected to drive significant new-user growth with targeted marketing.

---
### Milestone 4: User Balance Growth - Stacking, DeFi & sBTC Yield

**Duration:** 275 hours - 7 weeks

**Budget:**¬†$24,750

**Outcome:**

- Users move from casual play into real DeFi participation. They can **buy STX/sBTC/BTC in-app** and deploy into stacking for yield, with BTC-denominated returns clearly displayed.

**Deliverables:**

- **Stacking Module** - 80h
    - Integrate stacking pool contracts.
    - Backend cycle tracker and reward data.
    - UI for stacking progress and yield.
- **Purchase Integration** - 70h
    - Integrate MoonPay, Topper, Revolut APIs.
    - Present fiat ‚Üí token flows as native in-app purchases.
    - Testing deposits and wallet crediting.
- **DeFi Module** - 60h
    - Simplified user flows for lending/AMM created on top of existent DeFi protocols in the ecosystem.
- **sBTC Yield Module** - 25h
    - One click enrollment.
    - Display BTC-denominated yields in-app.
- **Scalability & Security** - 40h
    - Simulate concurrent stacking and DeFi interactions.
    - Validate accuracy of reward and yield distribution.
    - Security audit of external protocol and payment integrations.

**Expected traction:**

- ~500 new active wallets (created by the app‚Äôs users participating in stacking, DeFi and sBTC yield).

**Purpose:**

- Convert new Web2 users into long-term Web3 participants by introducing core concepts in a straightforward way, emphasizing retention.

## Total Estimated Duration: 825 hours
## Estimated Release Date: Q1 2026
## Full project details [here](https://degenlab.notion.site/stacks-mobile-app-web2-ux-web3-growth)

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks team, looks very interesting! I am wondering if you could please rework the milestones to align with the budget unlock. Ala, let's establish what success looks like at Milestone 1 such that the community can understand 'this is working' in terms of real growth/traction, etc. such that its obvious we should unlock further funding. Our strong preference is to see early MVPs and proof of concepts with real testers/in the wild feedback and traction before approving larger amounts. This allows us to derisk the grant and ensure that what is being built is getting adopted along the way (vs. ending up in January with something that isn't as important as we guessed). 

For example, if feasible, I'd highly recommend you work with one of the major wallet teams or apps straight away so that you can test the Google login feature with an established user base. Both Xverse and Leather already have established mobile apps, so this would significantly cut down upfront costs to build something from scratch, allowing us to prove and perfect this with both real users and real builders before building out all the rest or having to bootstrap testers on your own.

I'd be happy to setup some calls with folks you may explore this with because I don't see creating an entirely separate app to start as the leanest way to prove this out. Essentially, I'd like to see you flip this and build and perfect the SDK first, onboard an app or two, then branch out into a separate mobile app. I feel pretty strongly that this would maximize early impact and make further funding an easy decision.

## üôÇ Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
- **Email:** ‚Äänortinex@gmail.com
- **Twitter:**‚Ää [@SkullcoinBTC](https://x.com/Skullcoinbtc)
- **Main project/association:** Skullcoin (Find2Earn + Encrypted NFTs + Strike combat layer)
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
- 3√ó Bitcoin/Stacks hackathon winner (Clarity smart contracts; community-recognized builder).
- 1,000+ Find2Earn game rounds; 150+ unique winners; $20,000+ total prize payouts on Stacks (SIP-10 tokens), with Leather + .btc onboarding for winners. 
- On-chain games with Encrypted NFTs: Competitve 2,500+ eNFTs minted, on-chain burn/merge progression, reached top volumes on Gamma; plus F2P Storyline (encrypted, 5 episodes) with 1800+ eNFTs minted and vault burns.

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:**‚ÄäSkullcoin: Strike ‚Äî Sustainable Combat on Stacks (Bitcoin L2)
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $30,000 ‚Äî core contracts, backend, security (SIP-31 request). UI/UX & QA will be co-funded via DeGrants or our treasury.
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Deliver a provably-fair, sustainable PvP & co-op PvE combat layer on Stacks‚Äîcomplete with audited Clarity contracts, backend, and a mobile-first playable demo‚Äîtightly integrated with our existing Find2Earn funnel.
- **Grant Audience:**‚Ää‚ÄäPrimarily users/players and NFT collectors; secondarily Stacks developers (open-source contracts & patterns) and Bitcoin L2 builders (sBTC sinks/payouts)
- **Grant Team:**
‚Ää[@xenitron](https://x.com/Xenitron) Ivan - CEO
[@bogachev_anton](https://x.com/bogachev_anton) - CTO [Github](https://github.com/proofofgame)
CSO (Security), Artist, UX/UI Designer, Game Designer, Frontend/Backend Engineer 
- **Additional support**: Stacks Foundation agreed to cover $700 for legal review of our Seed Phrase Hunt  (Encrypted NFTs).

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäBuild Strike, a tactical combat layer where players choose attack/defense across 4 zones (simultaneous turns), run co-op raids (1/3 Boss chance), and earn damage-proportional payouts‚Äîwhile the economy remains self-funded via gameplay sinks (Repair, Reroll, Merge/Burn, and ticketing). Core randomness and move integrity are verifiable (commit-reveal + Bitcoin block hash entropy), and all key flows are on Stacks.
- **Grant Impact:**‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäStrike converts our proven Find2Earn audience into on-chain Stacks users, driving wallet activations, recurring transactions, and market activity around Gear NFTs. We will also ship reusable Clarity patterns (commit-reveal randomness, durability/repair NFTs, on-chain raid coordination) and showcase practical sBTC use (ticketing, repairs, and boss payouts).
- **Grant Risks:**
- Economic imbalance (faucets > sinks) ‚Üí live-ops ‚Äúdials‚Äù (repair price, raid rate, boss pool, drop mix) with telemetry; target cover-ratio 1.3‚Äì1.6.
- Fairness/cheating ‚Üí commit-reveal for PvP choices, BTC-seeded randomness for loot; on-chain event anchors and public verification guide.
- Bots/Sybil ‚Üí Soul-gated access (NFT), novice caps, behavior heuristics, signed short-TTL links; referral rewards paid only on first purchase & first successful PvE run.

- **Traction:**
- Active users: 150+ unique winners; 1,000+ Find2Earn rounds; Storyline F2P: ~1.8k+ encrypted NFT mints; Competitive hunt: 2,500+ mints with $10000+ payouts.
- Transaction volume: Thousands of on-chain NFT mints/burns/merges
- TVL: Not applicable (game layer; treasury flows tracked, not custodial TVL).
- Waitlist: we run live onboarding via daily games and stream partners.

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverable:**‚Ää
- Clarity contracts: Soul Slots (access NFT), GearNFT (rarity, durability, merge/repair), Economy (fees/treasury), RaidManager (loot distribution & randomness), PvPCommit (move commit-reveal).
- Backend: combat/raid simulator, fairness proofs, logs, signed URL service (for future Encrypted NFT hooks), anti-bot gating.
- Frontend: mobile-first ‚Äúmanga-in-motion‚Äù duel UI + basic raid flow; wallet connect; inventory & repair/reroll/merge panels; dashboards (cover-ratio, activity).
- Docs & open-source: tests, verification guide, and a public Fairness page.

- **Milestones:** 

We fully agree with the lean, data-driven approach. We have reordered our milestones to prioritize a true MVP, validating the core "fun factor" before building out the full economy.

**Milestone 1: The "True MVP" - A Playable 1v1 Duel Demo (Weeks 1‚Äì4, $9,960)**

Goal: Get the core combat loop into players' hands ASAP to validate one thing: Is the game fun?

Deliverables: A web-based, mobile-first 1v1 duel interface. A simplified backend combat simulator. Basic Clarity contracts for a set of pre-minted "demo" Gear NFTs (no durability or drops yet).

‚úÖ Success Criteria for Unlocking Further Funding:

Achieve 1,000+ duels played by 200+ unique wallets within 30 days of launch.

Onboard 100+ net new users (wallets created/connected to try the demo).

Achieve a community feedback score of >80% "would play again."

**Milestone 2: Building the Economy - PvE & Sinks - (Weeks 5‚Äì8, $12,120)**

Goal: Once the MVP is proven fun, we build the sustainable economic engine around it.

Deliverables: Implement the core economic contracts: Gear durability & repair sinks (using sBTC/Skull). Simple PvE battles against mobs. On-chain loot drops (VRF-based). Basic NFT merging.

‚úÖ Success Criteria for Unlocking Further Funding:

Process 500+ on-chain repair transactions.

Demonstrate a positive Sinks/Faucets ratio on a micro-scale.

Achieve 2,000+ PvE battles completed.

**Milestone 3: Scaling to Co-op & Full Integration - (Weeks 9‚Äì12, $7,920)**

Goal: With a fun core loop and a working economy, we scale to the full social and cross-game experience.

Deliverables: Full 4-player co-op raid functionality. Boss mechanics with damage-based payouts. Full integration of sBTC for ticketing and prize pools. Crucially, linking the Find2Earn game to Strike, where discovering world locations unlocks raid access.

‚úÖ Success Criteria:

Successfully run 100+ full co-op raids.

Process a meaningful volume of transactions using sBTC.

Demonstrate the full, sustainable economic flywheel in a live environment.

## üßÆ Sustainable Economy

- Core loop: PvE raids (4 players). Each raid drops exactly one Gear NFT (25% per player). 1/3 of raids escalate to a Boss ‚Üí payouts split by damage.
- Sinks: Durability Repair (primary), Reroll, Merge/Burn (5‚Üí1 rarity trade-up), and ticketing for 50% of daily raid seats. Merge only at full durability ‚Üí forces repair before burn.
- Faucets: Boss payouts + events.
- Balance condition: ‚àësinks‚â•‚àëfaucets over a 7‚Äì30d window; live-ops dials (repair price, raid rate, boss pool, drop mix).
- sBTC use cases: ticketing, repairs, tournament escrow, and optional boss payouts (configurable per season) to showcase Bitcoin-denominated spend & rewards on Stacks.

**Detailed economy & formulas, budget breakdown, and UI screenshots:** [Notion link](https://notch-lens-325.notion.site/Skullcoin-Grants-2025-2757d5fab641803686cdf351115d14b5?source=copy_link)

Thanks for your application! A few questions:

- How many MAUs do you currently have? Please provide this figure and then separately a projection for the *new* users you would expect this grant to generate and the rationale for the projection (aka show us your math üôè )
- How do you see the funding working against milestones? How can we get something into the market with fewer expenses so we can drive back some more data that its working and there's a clear demand to double down on? There seems to be a lot of upfront building of recyclable aspects and contracts (which is fine), but I think we risk building a ton of stuff without first proving we can market this thing and onboard a ton of folks first. Could you take a stab at flipping the milestones such that get to market as quickly as possible against the smallest budget possible (ala a true MVP) and then for subsequent milestones list the success criteria where you think it would be fair to open up further funding. 

And separately/generally, I'd like to better understand the bet for Bitcoiners here. Do we feel that games built on Stacks are particularly well-suited to provide a best in class experience or to enable a new audience that wouldn't otherwise participate to do so? If so, why? Here I'm just looking for your higher-level thesis as I'm not an expert in gaming - I have not seen a particularly fervent community of gamers overlapping with Bitcoiners, but would love to see some data about how it's there and just outside my particular bubble.

Thanks!

issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information
- **Email:** isaacomenuche@gamil.com  
- **Twitter:** [@iflames_1](https://x.com/iflames_1)  
- **Main project/association:** [Stacks wars](https://x.com/StacksWars)  
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**  
  - Founder and lead developer of Stacks wars, a multiplayer GameFi platform built on Stacks.  

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** Stacks Wars Growth Scheme  
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $32,000  
  - $12,000 - team salary support (1k x 12 months)  
  - $10,000 - development costs, UI redesign, platform improvements, app launch  
  - $10,000 - sponsored events and tournaments  

- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Sustain and expand Stacks wars over the next 12 months by delivering new games, a mobile app, and community-driven tournaments that drive measurable on-chain activity. 
- **Grant Audience:** Gamers (both casual and competitive)  
- **Grant Team:**  
  - [@iflames_1](https://x.com/iflames_1) - Founder, Developer  
  - [@iatomic_1](https://x.com/iatomic_1) - Developer  
  - [@oak_crypt](https://x.com/oak_crypt) - Community Lead  
  - [@Hikmahcodes](https://x.com/Hikmahcodes) - Social Media Manager  
  - [@iPeter_crx](https://x.com/iPeter_crx) - Designer  
  - [@ID_CRYPTO12](https://x.com/ID_CRYPTO12) - Ambassador  
  - [@Hazybtc](https://x.com/Hazybtc) - Community Moderator  

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**  
  Stacks wars‚Äô mission is to bridge Web2 gamers into the Stacks ecosystem by building engaging, skill-based, on-chain games with real rewards. Over the next year, we aim to scale our platform with new games, better UX, and tournaments that showcase the power of GameFi as a driver of user growth and blockchain adoption.

- **Grant Impact:**  
  This grant will help scale Stacks wars by expanding the game catalog, launching a mobile app, and running tournaments that showcase real on-chain utility. Our recently concluded Lexi wars testnet event generated over 1,000+ on-chain transactions and successfully onboarded at least 10 new users, proving that gaming can drive measurable adoption for Stacks.  

- **Grant Risks:**  
  - **Low adoption risk:** If players don‚Äôt consistently engage, growth could stall. *Mitigation:* run community events, sponsored tournaments, and integrate social features like leaderboards to boost retention.  
  - **Technical risk:** Scaling multiplayer infra and smart contracts. *Mitigation:* phased mainnet rollout, continuous testing, and contract audits before expansions.  

- **Traction:**  
  - **Active users:** 117 testnet players connected  
  - **Community size:** 178 real members in Telegram  
  - **On-chain activity:** 1,000+ transactions generated during Lexi wars testnet event  

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverables:**  
  - Launch 3 additional games on Stacks wars  
  - Host 3+ tournaments and cross-project collaborations  
  - Release a mobile app for improved onboarding and retention  
  - Maintain consistent platform activity and user growth  

- **Milestones:**  
  **Q4 2025 (Sept‚ÄìDec)**  
  - Mainnet rollout on Sept 22  
  - Launch second game (Stacks Sweeper)  
  - Run initial community events  

  **Q1 2026**  
  - UI redesign for improved UX  
  - Host community events  
  - Begin development of third game  

  **Q2 2026**  
  - Release mobile app (beta)  
  - Community events and test launch of new game  

  **Q3 2026**  
  - Official mobile launch with seasonal game content  
  - Expanded tournament schedule  

  **Q4 2026**  
  - Deprecate web app and fully transition to mobile  
  - Reward community using game fees, TVL, and remaining grant funds  
  - Scale events and community incentives  

---

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks @xyzerobtc, pretty clear overall. A couple questions/ideas:

- I think it is worth considering how we integrate/absorb the forum into your platform. I'd argue activity there should be weighted pretty heavily against regular social activity and you could do interesting things like show people a clear path to progress an idea/discussion from there to later stages of implementation, say into a grant or a SIP, etc. and show people the progression of work in the ecosystem by various parties.
- In terms of social data/ranking, if you haven't connected with Joe from LunarCrush already, it's probably worth a chat on where there could be some shortcuts leveraging some of the awesome stuff they've built. I'm especially curious what the 'formula' is here for reputation and how it has been made sufficiently un-gamable. Back to the Klout days, this has been a very hard problem to solve and you have to be quite opinionated about what makes a 'good' reputation as well. It would be great to understand that a bit further as one of the major features here is ultimately providing a score.
- For the NovaAI features, I'm inclined to believe this is a decent bet to make, but would love to know how much of sort of the 'basic personalization' we could get away with initially or if you think its just cheaper to jump straight to AI-based personalization. Even in the Wordpress days, we could do pretty good personalization and given the ecosystem isn't huge, I wonder if there's a sensible MVP of this feature or to hear that 'AI is the MVP' in this case. We don't really have *any* personalization today - a hub that's uniquely mine that also allows for some training would be great, for example I'd like to 'follow' specific grants or SIPs or discussions, etc. and be able to see those in my dashboard while deprioritizing things I'm less interested in.
- Would you plan to offer jobs/gigs as part of these personalized offerings? I assume so since you have this module already, but I am curious how folks would be validated for certain recommended positions. In my experience, the real risk here is that employers don't immediately get hits on their listings via the platform and so they move away, or worse, they get unqualified recommendations and consider the candidates there spam. I'd like to hear the loose plan to ensure that doesn't happen - there are whole companies dedicated to job/gig boards and it's not simple to crack but would also be HUGE if you did. 

Last but not least, when we connect next, let's discuss how/where this overlaps with the ideas we've talked about and whether or not the grant is the best vehicle for funding this work or some more ongoing contract like we've discussed too. We're generally flexible in aligning these things to the best format for all and we'd like to be an active/ongoing partner in helping you develop and amplify the features we've talked about, particularly in light of narrowing our focus to Governance over time as Stacks Labs boots up :).

cuevasm_comments.body:
Yeah agreed, it's something we talked about in our first call as well. I don't find that its currently *not* transparent, all that is recorded in the SIP, social, etc. it's more that on any given day its harder to see what the status is because these are often discussions happening among a group and they need to report back. Simply giving labels to what is already happening and having a place to refresh/check on where we are in the SIP lifecycle would be a good step forward. 

One thing I think is really important to watch out for with real-time voting results though, is the impact of influence. For example, we often hold our vote to the very end as not to shade anyone's decision or create any sense of pressure. I think if you start to let votes be led by cults of personality (i.e. a group that will just blindly vote along one influencers opinion because they really like them) rather than individuals making their own decisions, that can be dicey. It's something to figure out in implementation and I think there are big questions to answer about people's right to vote privately that this surfaces, but I think it's solvable.

My suggestion would be to focus first on the high-level SIP status tracker and nail that experience before layering in this concept of a reputation score on everyone's vote.

## Applicant Information

* **Main project/association:** Let Africa Build (LAB) ‚Äì Africa‚Äôs first Bitcoin L2 development hub & incubator
* **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**

  * Onboarded and trained **300+ developers** across Africa and Australia via Stacks programs in 18 months.
  * Built **Stacks Nigeria** from scratch, scaling developer & Creator engagement by 300%.
  * Secured interest from universities, corporates, and NGOs to support LAB‚Äôs rollout.
  * Restructuring Stacks Africa & paving the pathway to a reformed Stacks Africa Foundation
  * Supported several Stacks Projects & Community Initiative
  * Recognized by the foundation in the [Stacks Blog](https://stacks.org/stacks-labs-setup#sam)
  * more impacts from [Sam](https://www.notion.so/Sam-1eb9882c54ba80f987c5ebb62386020d?source=copy_link)

---
## Let Africa Build (LAB)

### About

Let Africa Build (LAB) is Africa's first Bitcoin development hub and incubator. We train and incubate smart contract developers who build Bitcoin-based infrastructures, leveraging the leading Layer 2 solution, Stacks. We are building an ecosystem of developers and web3 start-up founders across the continent, equipped with the skills and tools needed to deliver scalable economic solutions in Africa.

---

## Grant Overview

* **Grant Name:** *LAB: Bitcoin Builders Africa ‚Äì Multi-State Pilot*
* **Total Budget (USD):** \$60,000 (STX equivalent)
* **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Build Africa‚Äôs first sponsor-funded, multi-state Bitcoin development ecosystem, training 500+ developers, incubating 5 startups, and deploying Bitcoin nodes in 3 hubs within 12 months.
* **Grant Audience:** Developers, founders, university students, corporates, NGOs, and government stakeholders across Nigeria.
* **LAB Team:**

  * [@TheLiberalThumb](https://x.com/TheLiberalThumb) (Founder, LAB)
  * [@electra_frost](https://x.com/electra_frost) (Strategic Finance Partner)
  * [@1770](https://x.com/1770) (Project Advisor & Strategic Partner)
  * [@AgeNeutral](https://x.com/AgeNeutral) (LAB Instructor)
  * [@armolas_06](https://x.com/armolas_06) (LAB Instructor)
  * [@Arowolokenny01](https://x.com/Arowolokenny01) (LAB Instructor)
  * [@NIETTANFT](https://x.com/NIETTANFT) (Brand & Creative Director)

* **LAB Mentors:**

  * [@PeaceLoveMusicG](https://x.com/PeaceLoveMusicG)
  * [@dantrevino](https://x.com/dantrevino)
  * [ Eric](https://x.com/ECBSJ)
  * [@melbelle_btc](https://x.com/melbelle_btc)
  * [@BrendynHadfield](https://x.com/BrendynHadfield)

---

## Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

### Mission

LAB‚Äôs mission is to build Africa‚Äôs first Bitcoin development hub and incubator, anchored on Stacks. With this grant, LAB will roll out sponsor-funded workshops, boot camps, hubs, and an incubation pipeline across Nigeria, documenting a scalable model for Bitcoin adoption across Africa. 

### Impact

* Train 500 developers across Lagos, Abuja, and Port Harcourt. 
* Establish 3 hubs with Bitcoin nodes to support real-world building.
* Run 6 workshops, 3 bootcamps, and 1 national hackathon.
* Incubate 5 startups with \$5,000 seed each.
* Publish an annual Ecosystem Impact Report with measurable ROI for sponsors and Stacks Foundation.

### Risks & Mitigation

* **Competition (ALX, Binance, Web3Bridge):** Offset by sponsor-funded model (free seats) and Bitcoin-first specialization.
* **Execution risk (multi-state rollout):** Controlled through phased milestones and partner hubs.
* **Trainer retention:** Mitigated with equity contracts + ecosystem visibility.
* **Regulation:** Framed as ‚Äúskills training & Youth empowerment program‚Äù backed by 2 government administrators already engaged.

### Traction

* Partners in waiting: 4 top universities, ALX Africa, 2 influential government personnel, 2 international NGOs.
* Confirmed ecosystem partners: ALX Africa, TNGG, Lions Club for co-hosted workshops and bootcamps.
* LAB is registered and licensed to operate RC - 8777525

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks Sam, happy to see this one come through. A few questions to start:
- Have you looked into bringing down the startup costs for the hubs? These strike me as the perfect things to have donated by local coworking spaces and/or municipalities. In my days building up Startup Weekend, we were often able to get very heavily discounted or free equipment and space for educational purposes. It seems like with the partners and government contacts you have, this is an area you could really bring down costs and give these parties a clear way to bring value to the program, thereby getting them even more invested in your success.
- Next, relative to the costs of other programming we do, $10,000 against 3x workshops times 100-200 attendees is a bit high - it would be stronger if we could ensure that these attendees aren't simply attendees, but actual converts to an ongoing program or deep embed into the Stacks ecosystem, perhaps Code4STX or something like that. I've mentioned this to Adam and Kenny so they could work with you on some solutions there. For the cost, we'll need to see _very_ high retention.
- Could you also speak to a bit more about how the Bitcoin nodes directly benefit the participants or the Stacks network? (Beyond the obvious that its just better to have more nodes in the world?) üôè.
- How much of the efforts here will be Stacks-focused vs. more general or other ecosystems? Is it something like 80/20? 50/50? If I understand the vision correctly this is bigger than just Stacks, which is great, I just think we all want to understand the high-level focus mix. 

Thinking ahead a bit, there's a chance I'd recommend you work directly with the Stacks Labs team on this vs. a Stacks Foundation grant. As we move through this transition, their team is taking up driving events/marketing/devrel/etc. while we tighten our focus on governance matters. Through them you can better align with the rest of the global marekting and devrel efforts that are all tied into their product team who is working on clear guiding metrics. Especially considering a major percentage of the activity proposed here is workshop and event based, it may just make a lot more sense to plug you in with them -- I'll reach out to them and come back to you on it!

Thanks!

cuevasm_comments.body:
Hey again @cliqueengagements - the committee is working toward approving this. Here's where things stand:

1. We want to see more clearly what your expectations/projections are around how many people will join Stacks at each of these milestones. This is an important disctinction between 'attendees' - we want to know the expected retention numbers to the ecosystem either through joining other programs like Code4STX, Ascent, or by staying around and building something in the ecosystem such that we'd consider them 'onboarded' or 'retained' for the eco. These projections will be important so we can see if this is benefitting Stacks along the way as much as we expect it to - as these folks join and numbers are strong, continued funding is straightforward.
2. Upon funding the first milestone (pending the input we need from you on item 1), we'll require that you connect directly with the Stacks Labs team to ensure that your efforts are integrated into the global event and content strategy on some level. This will ensure you have support of major Stacks social channels and some of the other resources that will likely be useful to you in many aspects of this endeavor. I will take the action item to connect you and set the context.
3. Next, we propose that instead of funding an initial Milestone of $10k, we deploy $20k such that you have more wiggle room upfront. As such, the M1 expectations/projections I'm asking for in item 1 maybe need to be bumped up just a touch. Our thinking is that a bigger initial payment, based on the strength of your previous efforts, helps build stability and legitimacy for more partnerships and onboarding of other parties before you have to worry about M2 too quickly. As a condition of this, we will discuss reporting to the sponsorship team at Stacks Labs to ensure we're maximizing every opportunity to pull in other dollars to fund your events and workshops alongside the Foundation's. I would look at this more as a resource/service to you more than raw oversight - the team there is happy to put the network to use to help you pull in sponsorships as we see this as very 'sponsorable' (not a word?) ü§£

Please let us know if this is amenable and please take a swing at updating the milestones from attendees to retained devs (or similar) and we can move this forward. 

Thanks!

issues.body:
## Applicant Information

**Email:** rossragsdale@gmail.com
**Twitter:** @lordrozar
**Main Project/Association:** Welshcorgicoin (WELSH) - First Bitcoin L2 memecoin to achieve product-market fit

**Notable Ecosystem Achievements:**
- **WELSH Community Leadership** - Steward of Stacks' largest memecoin community with 20,000+ unique wallets of holders, organic growth without venture funding, and proven ability to drive ecosystem-wide user adoption
- **Stacks Foundation Developer Relations** - Official DevRel role since June 2025, created countless hours of technical education content, comprehensive developer resources, and production infrastructure
- **Charisma DeFi Platform** - Architected and deployed full-stack DeFi platform managing $2M+ peak TVL, demonstrating production-grade smart contract and liquidity management expertise

---

## Grant Overview

**Grant Name:** WELSH 5-Year Stakeholder Acquisition Engine

**Total Budget:** $1,000,000 USD in STX

**Grant Goal:** Systematize WELSH as Stacks' user acquisition engine through 5-year daily DCA that creates stakeholders (not just users) following the proven BONK playbook, generating measurable ecosystem growth through aligned financial incentives and emotional community attachment.

**Grant Audience:** Prospective Stacks users attracted through speculation opportunity, existing 20,000+ WELSH unique wallets who became organic evangelists, Stacks DeFi ecosystem benefiting from sustained trading activity, and broader Bitcoin L2 participants seeking proven community-driven growth models.

**Grant Team:**
- Ross Ragsdale (GitHub: @r0zar) - Lead Author & Community Steward
- GPSC [gigapepe92@gmail.com] - Community Coordination
- Justin Enjo (GitHub: @enjoywithouthey) - Strategic Advisor

---

## Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

### Grant Mission

WELSH already drove Stacks' largest user adoption curve in Q4 2023, demonstrating organic capability to attract and retain ecosystem participants. This grant systematizes that proven success by following the institutional playbook established by Solana Foundation's backing of BONK: deploy consistent, transparent liquidity support to flagship memecoin, creating speculation-driven user acquisition that converts into lasting stakeholder engagement.

Daily DCA deployment ($550 STX/day over 5 years) creates predictable trading opportunity that attracts new users to Stacks infrastructure. Unlike traditional marketing spend that creates passive users, every WELSH holder becomes organic evangelist‚Äîtheir investment value depends on Stacks ecosystem success, creating self-sustaining promotion engine. STX issued from Treasury flows directly into ecosystem-wide aggregated liquidity pools and burns atomically to permanent address, eliminating custody risk and ensuring liquidity benefits all Stacks DEXes equally.

### Grant Impact

**Solana Foundation backed BONK explicitly as user acquisition tool. Result: millions of new Solana users, sustained ecosystem growth, and flagship community asset. This grant replicates that institutional playbook for Stacks.**

**Stakeholders, Not Just Users:**

Every WELSH holder becomes organic evangelist. Their bag's value depends on Stacks success‚Äîfinancially incentivized to onboard friends, create promotional content, and build applications. The "dog coin" pattern (DOGE, SHIB, BONK) creates emotional attachment traditional tokens cannot replicate: cultural phenomenon, not just financial instrument. Beyond financial incentives, WELSH creates tribal identity and emotional attachment. Holders promote Stacks from genuine enthusiasm, not just profit motive. This combination of aligned financial incentives and emotional community attachment produces exceptional stickiness‚ÄîWELSH holders exhibit unusual loyalty to both token and Stacks ecosystem.

**Quantifiable 5-Year Outcomes:**

- **User Acquisition:** 2,000-5,000 new Stacks wallets created through speculation participation (conservative: 1-2 new users daily over 5 years)
- **Transaction Volume:** 20-50x increase in WELSH daily trading volume = sustained DEX fee generation benefiting validators and liquidity providers
- **Ecosystem Discovery:** Speculators arriving for WELSH discover sBTC, NFTs, DeFi applications‚Äîorganic user funnel to entire Stacks infrastructure
- **Permanent Liquidity:** $1M in trustless, burned liquidity becomes ecosystem-wide asset supporting future growth
- **Organic Promotion:** 20,000+ stakeholders generating social media content, developer interest, and cross-chain attention without marketing budget

**Financial Responsibility:**

Unlike Foundation grants funding development with uncertain user outcomes, this delivers measurable cost-per-acquired-user. Traditional crypto marketing: $1,000+ CAC with high churn. This grant: estimated 2,000-5,000 new stakeholders at $200-500 CAC who financially depend on Stacks success (5-year retention built-in). More fiscally disciplined than traditional grants lacking CAC tracking or user conversion metrics.

**Zero STX Price Impact:**

Unique among SIP-031 grants: this proposal does not require STX price appreciation to succeed. Funds burn immediately to permanent liquidity. Foundation maintains zero ongoing obligation, zero custody risk, and zero dependency on market conditions for grant impact delivery.

### Grant Risks & Mitigation

**Reputational Considerations:**

Solana Foundation backing BONK as explicit user acquisition tool established institutional precedent. We follow proven playbook, not experimental approach. DOGE ranks 8th crypto by market cap; memecoins demonstrate institutional legitimacy and proven user adoption capability across Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana ecosystems. WELSH already drove Stacks' largest adoption surge (Q4 2023 - Q1 2024)‚Äîthis grant scales demonstrated success rather than speculating on unproven theory.

**Foundation Safety:**

Trustless burn mechanism eliminates traditional grant risks. Funds cannot be misappropriated, withdrawn, or controlled by any individual or team. STX issued from Treasury directly into ecosystem-wide aggregated liquidity pools, burned atomically. No single protocol or team controls funds. Safer than traditional grants where builders maintain custody and discretionary spending authority. Fully verifiable on-chain.

**Execution Reliability:**

5-year linear deployment ($550 STX/day) allows adaptive response to market conditions while maintaining consistent opportunity for user acquisition. Daily DCA front-running is proven mechanism (historical precedent: every announced DCA schedule creates speculation and trading activity). Market volatility mitigated by extended timeline spanning multiple cycles.

### Traction Data

## Applicant Information
- **Email:** atomic.k.2739@gmail.com  
- **Twitter:** [@iatomic_1](https://x.com/iatomic_1)  
- **Main project/association:** [StacksWars](https://x.com/StacksWars/)  
- **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**  
  - Collaborated with [Eric @ Hiro](https://x.com/ECBSJ) and Turnkey's team on integrating [Turnkey](https://www.turnkey.com/) on Stacks.  
  - Founder of the first web trading bot on Stacks.  

## Grant Overview
- **Grant Name:** _The Way Forward For Stacks | Dexion Grants Proposal_  
- **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $11,995 USD  
- **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Make trading available for everyone seamlessly.  
- **Grant Audience:** _Current DeFi users on Stacks and onboarding thousands of new users to Stacks._  
- **Grant Team:** _[@iatomic_1](https://github.com/iatomic1/)_  

## Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction
- **Grant Mission:**  
  _The Dexion Grant‚Äôs mission is to onboard new users into the Stacks ecosystem, make trading simple and accessible for everyone, and deliver powerful tools like Wallet Tracker, Price Alerts, and more. It aims to enhance the trading experience across all major Stacks apps, including Velar, Bitflow, Alex, stx.city, and fak.fun._  

- **Grant Impact:**  
  _If successful, the Dexion Grant will onboard thousands of new users into the Stacks ecosystem by making trading and DeFi tools as simple as Web2 apps. Traders will have measurable benefits such as easier wallet tracking, real-time price alerts, and seamless integrations across Velar, Bitflow, Alex, stx.city, and fak.fun. This will increase active users, trading volumes, and liquidity across Stacks platforms, strengthening the ecosystem and attracting users from outside chains. Builders would also have access to new tools Dexion would provide like DexionSDK, DEXWallet, and DEXApi._  

- **Grant Risks:**  
  - Low user adoption if onboarding strategies fail  
  - Cooperation from current trading platforms (we currently have access to the Bitflow SDK)  

- **Traction:**  
  - **Active users:** 22  
  - **Transaction volume:** 150+ transactions signed through Dexion to date  
  - **Waitlist:** 25  
  - **Partnerships:**  
    - **Bitflow**: Integrated with Bitflow and secured access to their SDK for deeper DEX functionality  
    - **TradingView**: Got access to TradingView for advanced charting and analytics integration  

## Grant Roadmap & Deliverables
- **Deliverables:**  
  - **Website**: Unified trading platform to swap tokens across all DEXes in one interface  
  - **Telegram Bot**: Sync and access your Dexion data directly within Telegram  
  - **DEXWallet**: Developer-ready wallet infrastructure for building bots, tools, and apps powered by users‚Äô Dexion wallets  
  - **DEXApi**: Generalized API and SDK enabling developers to interact with all Stacks DEXes and launchpads through a single integration  

- **Milestones in 3 months:**  
  - **Milestone 1**: Establish core trading infrastructure with unified DEX aggregation on Stacks (Closed Source) + integrate embedded wallet (Turnkey) for seamless Web2 onramp  ‚úÖ
  - **Milestone 2**: Release DEXApi (Open Source) to unify trading, liquidity, and launchpad access under one SDK + ship Website MVP with wallet management and basic trading  ‚úÖ
  - **Milestone 3**: Deploy DEXWallet (Closed Source) with developer access for bots/tools/apps + launch Telegram Bot with data sync and wallet features  

## Others
- Everything Demo'd on here is currently live @ [dexion.pro](https://dexion.pro)
- [Demo Video](https://www.loom.com/share/0cf700bb1e5a429a80faf53ffd70deae?sid=a8b7debe-09a4-41f5-a60d-1b23a3c071b9)

issues.body:
## üôÇ Applicant Information

-   **Email:** ibrqhimabdulkarim193@gmail.com
-   **Twitter:**‚Ää@iabdulkarim472
-   **Main project/association:** StableWallet (decentralized financial
    wallet on tbDEX + cross-chain integrations)
-   **Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:**
    -   Built StableWallet during TBDex Hackathon and continued
        development post-hackathon.
    -  Consistent active contributor through Code4Stacks for almost a year, leading hackathons and Learn-to-Earn    initiatives.
    -   Consistently building open-source prototypes that extend
        real-world adoption use cases (identity, payments, and DeFi
        tools).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üìÉ Grant Overview

-   **Grant Name:** Stacks Cross-Chain Wallet Integration
-   **Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):** $10,000 (paid in STX)
-   **Grant Goal (in one sentence):** Enable seamless fiat-to-crypto and
    cross-chain transactions directly within a Stacks-native wallet,
    boosting developer and user adoption.
-   **Grant Audience:** Developers, Web3 users, DeFi builders, ecosystem
    newcomers exploring Stacks as a daily financial tool.
-   **Grant Team:** Solo developer (github.com/aliveevie), with
    potential external contributors for audits.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

-   **Grant Mission:**
    The mission of this grant is to extend StableWallet with
    Stacks-native support and cross-chain transaction capabilities,
    making it possible for users to bridge value into Stacks directly
    from other ecosystems. By focusing on a simple, intuitive, and
    open-source integration, we aim to lower barriers to entry for new
    users.

-   **Grant Impact:**
    This grant will strengthen Stacks' position as a user-friendly
    gateway by enabling fiat on-ramps, cross-chain transfers, and a
    working wallet interface. If successful, the ecosystem will gain
    more active users conducting real transactions on Stacks, higher
    transaction volume, and new developer opportunities to build on the
    wallet SDK.

-   **Grant Risks:**

    -   **Liquidity limitations:** Cross-chain functionality may face
        bottlenecks depending on available bridges/exchanges.
        *Mitigation:* Partnering with existing PFI providers and
        open-source bridge solutions.
    -   **User adoption lag:** Even with strong tech, user traction may
        be slow. *Mitigation:* Collaborations with hackathons, Stacks
        community events, and Learn-to-Earn incentives.
    -   **Regulatory uncertainty around fiat on-ramps:** *Mitigation:*
        Begin with crypto-only transfers first, with fiat on-ramp
        modular for regions where compliant.

-   **Traction:**

    -   **Active users:** Early beta of StableWallet has ~150 signups
        from hackathon/demo participation.
    -   **Transaction volume:** Limited in testing phase but ~500 demo
        transactions processed.
    -   **TVL:** Not yet significant; early usage indicates interest in
        small transfers (\$20--50 range).
    -   **Waitlist:** 200+ interested users across hackathons and
        community programs (ArbiLearn & TBDex event).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

-   **Deliverable:**
    Open-source wallet integration for Stacks supporting:
    1.  STX deposits/withdrawals.
    2.  Cross-chain transfers (BTC ‚Üí STX, ETH ‚Üí STX).
    3.  SDK for developers to integrate payment flows.
-   **Milestones:**
    -   **Milestone 1 ($5k):** Release open-source StableWallet alpha
        with STX integration + wallet UI.
    -   **Milestone 2 ($4k):** Add BTC ‚Üí STX and ETH ‚Üí STX bridge
        support, plus transaction tracking.
    -   **Milestone 3 ($3.5k):** Launch SDK + developer documentation +
        community workshop/demo.

issues.title: Stacksinscription: smart contract version of inscription on Stacks
issues.body:
Applicant Information‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää‚Äâ
Email:‚Ää stacksinscription@gmail.com

Twitter:‚Ää@stx10_

Main project: stacksinscription.com  & stx10.com

Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:

Stacksinscription and stx10 are  basically the upgraded smart contract version of Ordinals inscription and brc20, without off-chain indexers, it's a first 100 percentage on-chain NFT and fair-launch meme token protocol in all chains, also the protocol is totally decentralised ,no contract owner, and never could be changeable.

üìÉ Grant Overview

Grant Name:‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäStacksinscription & STX10

Total Budget: $20000 for the grant sponsor

Grant Goal : 

Building a fullly onchain inscription NFT marketplace of Stacks and STX10 order book marketplace

Grant Audience:‚Ää‚Ää All Ordinals and brc20 uers who interested in on-chain NFT and fair-launched memes

Grant Team:‚Ää @stx10_
(with 7+ more years of Stacks ecosystem experience and 3+ years building on Stacks )

üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

Grant Mission:‚Ää
‚Ää
To build a on-chain inscription NFT marketplace and stx10 order-book marketplace on stacks, that will be a first fullly onchain NFT protocol and first fair-lauch meme protocol besides Bitcoin ordinals and brc20, makes Stacks unique from other blockchain, also stx10 has huge potential to make Stacks a  fair-mint meme chain distinguish from Solana.

Grant Impact:‚Ää‚Ää‚Ää

Each stx10 token mint burns 0.05stx, and can be easily wrapped to sip10 tokens at any time, it solves the liquidity and centralised problem of brc20 and the problem of pumpfun that memecoins launching are controlled by cabal groups , fulfiled with insight trading. 

We believe on-chain NFT and fair-launch memecin are future unavoidable tendency with huge potencial demand,if stacksinscription and stx10  succeed, it will bring tons of new users to Stacks network and burn millions of STX. 

Grant Risks:

For inscription part, the main risk is the inscription integration complexity, it's a challenge for mainstream NFT marketplace like Magiceden and Gamma to integrate stacksinscriptim, so we decided to build the on-chain inscription marketplace by ourselves. 

For stx10 part, it has low risk, because we could take advantage of existing Stacks defi platform like Alex and Velar very easily.

Traction:

Light spot: brand new innovation for traditional NFT protocol and fair-launch meme protocol

Active users: all time holders: 2000+ and 100k+ mints on stx10.

Community interests: different kinds of new protocols tries on bitcoin like Alkanes and BRC2.0 shows the strong demand for fair-launch meme protocol with smart contract, and stx10 is the first solution to achieve this goal.

üõ£Ô∏è Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

Deliverable:‚Ää The first fully-onchain inscription NFT marketplace on Stacks & stx10 order-book marketplace.

Roadmap (in 6 months)

1: For milestone 1,initial grant $10k to build inscription NFT marketplace and STX10 order-book marketplace before 12/2025.(1-2 months).  In the process of building marketplace, we estimate that there will be 1-2 teams start to inscribe theirs tiny collection on stacksinscription again(there ever were 4 teams trying to launch their collection), and individuals keep inscribing and inscription number grows from present 3577 to at least 4200.(inscription marketplace is ouf focus, stx10 orderbook place indeed has been finished , we only need to restart ,but in this period most stx10 volume will happen in Alex).

2: For milestone 2, invite some well-known NFT collection on Stacks migrate or launch their new collections on stacksinscription and achieve 3000+ independent active inscription users ( the largest collection on Stacks has 3131 holders)to unlock additional $10k funds.

The estimated parameters:  there will be at least 2 former well-known NFT teams launching or migrating their collections on stacksinscription, the inscription numbers will grow to at least 12000, and independent owners addresses will grow from 333 to at least 3300. Also the inscription NFT inscribing activities will promote stx10 tokens minting activities, there will at least 20k new mints on stx10.

3: getting mainstream marketplace and wallet integration like Gamma,Xverse, Leather.( within 3 months)

4: stx10 achieves first 1M mints out of "satoshi" tick and burns 50K STX.(within 4 months).

5: stx10 achieves 5M mints at least and burns 250k STX or more.(with 6 months).

- Email:‚Ää admin@tenero.io
- Twitter:‚Ää @milanocuts ‚Ää@reubs_btc
- Main project/association: STXTools ‚Äì the leading DEX tracking platform for the Stacks ecosystem
- Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:
  - Built and maintained STXTools, the most widely used Dexscreener-style product on Stacks for the past 18 months
  - Onboarding 1000s of new users to the Stacks ecosystem via $LEO and Leo Cats NFT mint
  - Achieving top mindhshare in Stacks for stxtools, leo and Reubs' personal account
  - Our public API is widely used by other projects and platforms across the Stacks ecosystem
  - Currently building a next-gen live version with Bitcoin Layer 1 Runes integration to attract broader attention to the Stacks ecosystem  

## üìÉ Grant Overview
- Grant Name:‚Ää‚Ää‚ÄäTenero: Real-Time Analytics & Runes for Stacks 
- Total Budget (USD, STX, or BTC):‚Ää $50k
- Grant Goal (in one sentence): Expand STXTools into a live, Runes-integrated analytics platform with richer data, deeper metrics, and broader reach across the Stacks ecosystem.
- Grant Audience: ‚ÄäDeFi traders on both Stacks L2 and BTC L1 looking for real-time token and pool data, NFT collectors tracking asset ownership and activity, and Stacks developers who rely on our public API and upcoming documentation to power their own applications, dashboards, and analytics tools. Tenero serves both end users and builders by offering accessible data and infrastructure.
- Grant Team:‚Ää‚Ää @MilanoCuts @reubs_btc

## üöÄ Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

cuevasm_comments.body:
Thanks for your application! As we review, I'd love to understand more about the longer term plan for sustainability.

Stxtools has been in the wild for some time and has previously stated the following: "We haven‚Äôt ever taken funding from anyone and it still is self funded to this day. We provide a key service and the product has been revenue generating for a while now and with our new release it will boost revenue a lot" - https://x.com/reubs_btc/status/1952031526717124854

This was last month, so I am curious about a couple key things:
- Has the team's thinking about taking funding changed? 
- Did the new release mentioned in this tweet have the expected impact of increasing revenue? Why or why not?
- What happens with the tools after the grant money is used up? What are the plans for funding the efforts/costs of ongoing maintenance?

Separately, I want to better understand what drives your expectations in this statement: "We expect to 3x our user base, double API usage". I don't know that I'm ready to accept that its as simple as additional documentation or integrations (that's a bit build it and they will come) so I would like to better understand the rationale for these projections. Things like direct indications from the existing user base about this demand, customer validation surveys, waitlists, etc. are helpful on this.

Last but not least, has there been clear evidence that building inroads to Runes has onboarded Stacks users/benefitted the network? I assume so, but would like to see that data added to your proposal as its a key assumption/mechanism that this grant is based around. 

Thanks!

cuevasm_comments.body:
I didn't suggest you were building a 'Runes platform', I was looking for some rationale or deeper assessment/data about what gives you the confidence that you will pull these users to Stacks and what the primary value proposition is for them to enter the ecosystem through this funnel. The best I can tell, it is an educated guess and inferences based on some activity on Bitflow, which is not a problem to be clear. However, I am still probing to see what the very specific value props is for each of the audiences the platform plans to serve. Maybe you can more specifically articulate the user stories that your platform will serve and in what order? I think the proposal is suffering from there being a lot of stuff you're doing with the platform plus that there is some that already exists and so forth so its harder to parse than 'fresh' grant if that makes sense. As a result, I have personally lost sight of the underlying fundamentals and I think others may also be struggling to follow along if they aren't incredibly familiar with the existing platform and its intricacies. 

I want to be sure that what we approve is focused with a clear impact expected and has a clear way to judge its success quantitively. I think you can leave out the way you're planning to market this for now and focus on the product fundamentals as it's more important we all understand very clearly what is getting built that is 100% new, what is getting updated (and why), and what outcomes you expect to be driven by each of the new features 1 by 1. 

To be explicit in what I think helps the committee: Can you please list user stories for each of the primary audiences you intend to serve and put them in priority order along with the acquisition numbers you project? Ex. As a Runes trader I will be able to X or Y [expect to onboard ### of Runes traders. And on for the others you have mentioned in the application, i.e as a Stacks holder I can,... as a developer I can...and on :)

Let's reset there with product fundamentals/use cases that this grant opens up and we'll be much closer, thank you so much!

üôÇ Applicant Information

VoltFi | Stacks Grant Proposal

Name: Guy Zaniratto
Email: guy@voltfi.xyz
Twitter/X: [@gzani](https://github.com/gzani)
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/guylherme/

Main project/association: VoltFi.xyz ‚Äî Bitcoin Startup Lab alumnus, The Crypto Academy alumnus, Safary Marketing & BD Certification

Project Links:
Website: https://www.voltfi.xyz/
Twitter|X: https://x.com/VoltFiLabs

Notable ecosystem achievements or impact:
 ‚Ä¢ Launched product on Arch Network‚Äôs testnet with measurable traction and user adoption
 ‚Ä¢ Participated in ETH Denver (2024 & 2025) and BTC Las Vegas (speaker at DeFi panel)
 ‚Ä¢ Active member of Ordinals and Runes communities

Company Snapshot

 ‚Ä¢ Entity: VoltFi Inc. ‚Äî Delaware C‚ÄëCorp (bootstrapped for 10‚ÄØmonths).
 ‚Ä¢ Team: Two founders with deep derivatives, product, and Web3 growth experience.
 ‚Ä¢ Capital Raised: None ‚Äî fully self‚Äëfunded to date.
 ‚Ä¢ Pivot to Stacks: While we initially planned a pre-seed round, we decided to focus first on proving execution on Stacks through this grant.

Traction Metric (Arch Network Testnet - Since May‚ÄØ2025):

 ‚Ä¢ Active users: 4,956
 ‚Ä¢ Total trades: 77,835
 ‚Ä¢ Transaction volume: 18.5 BTC
 ‚Ä¢ Community: 67 ‚ÄúAngel‚Äù Discord members, 206 early‚Äëaccess e-mails
 ‚Ä¢ Social reach: Inorganic followers from Arch Network mission, cleanup underway

Grant Overview

Grant Name: Degen Options on Stacks
Milestone‚ÄëBased Grant Structure - Grant Budget (USD) $24,000

Grant Goal: Deploy a gamified Bitcoin options trading platform with single-sided liquidity on Stacks, enabling users to generate BTC yield.

Grant Audience: Bitcoin DeFi users seeking simple, transparent ways to trade volatility; developers and partners in the Stacks ecosystem who will benefit from expanded primitives.

Grant Team:

Guy Zaniratto (CEO & Co-founder)
E-mail: guy@voltfi.xyz
Twitter/X: [@gzani](https://x.com/gzani)
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/guylherme/

Ram Upendran (CTO & Co-founder)
E-mail: ram@voltfi.xyz
Twitter/X: [@ramudefi](https://x.com/ramudefi)
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ramupen/
Github: upbram

Grant Mission, Impact, Risks, and Traction

Grant Mission:
VoltFi‚Äôs mission is to make Bitcoin DeFi accessible by offering a simple yet powerful derivatives platform on Stacks. This grant will allow us to deploy and regulate our initial product, expanding primitives available to the ecosystem while demonstrating the strength of BTC-backed DeFi.

Grant Impact:
By introducing gamified options trading, we will unlock new liquidity sources for the Stacks ecosystem, give users tools to hedge downside, speculate, and generate yield, and attract both retail users and institutions. Our roadmap includes BTC, STX, and eventually Runes as supported assets.

Grant Risks & Mitigation:
The primary risks are insufficient funds to cover legal compliance and code audits. We are mitigating this by concurrently running a pre-seed strategic round to supplement the grant and ensure long-term sustainability.
Grant Roadmap & Deliverables

Proposed Milestones & Structure

We agree with the committee‚Äôs feedback to prioritize MVP delivery and user onboarding before heavy legal spend. Accordingly, we propose the following milestone-based structure:

   1. Milestone 1 ‚Äì Migrate App to Clarity-based on Stacks (30% of grant)
      - Deliver a Clarity-based MVP on Stacks testnet.
      - Enable first sBTC options trades with gamified UI.
      - Onboard the first 25 users and reach 100 transactions to test app
      - Timeline: Week 4

   2. Milestone 2 ‚Äì Closed Beta (Mainnet) - 30% of grant
      - Onboard the first 50 users and reach 200 transactions to test app
      - Demonstrating engagement through active wallets, unique users, and transactions.
      - Timeline: Week 6

   3. Milestone 3 ‚Äì Public Beta (Mainnet) - 40% of grant
      - Expand user base and interaction by launching a public beta on mainnet.
      - Demonstrating engagement through active wallets, unique users, and transactions.
      - Timeline: Week 8

Tech Highlights: Deployed on Arch Network testnet with Unisat wallet; Xverse integration is underway, Leather next in queue.

KPI Dashboard

   - #‚ÄØWallets connected
   - Daily/Weekly/Monthly Active Users
   - Average Revenue & Trading Volume per User
   - Daily Trading Volume, TVL, Fees Collected
   - sBTC staking returns per user/per week

Ecosystem Collaboration - Engagement & Support

   - We welcome support from the Stacks community for legal guidance and audit resources, reducing upfront costs.
   - A portion of the grant will be allocated to Clarity consulting and marketing.
   - We will highlight Stacks, sBTC, supported wallets, and ecosystem partners across all VoltFi communications.

Go‚ÄëTo‚ÄëMarket Plan

   - Points Engine: Rewards for high‚Äëfrequency traders and LPs
   - Zealy Sprint: Quest‚Äëbased buzz to amplify reach
   - Refreshed Landing Page: Waitlist + social proof
   - Messaging Line: ‚ÄúVoltFi ‚Äî Bitcoin Options, Unleashed on Stacks.‚Äù
